loans.name: Lidia Liliana

texts.es: Lidia tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, vive en Olanchito, Yoro. Ella tiene casi dos años de haber establecido su negocio de pulpería para dedicarse a vender productos de consumo diario como carnes, arroz, frijoles, harina, embutidos, lácteos, papel higiénico, productos enlatados, churros, condimentos, huevos, pan, dulces, granos básicos y otros abarrotes. Lidia ha solicitado este préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para surtir más el negocio de productos alimenticios y de un 10% del préstamo lo utilizara para hacer una reparación a su casa (repellar la pared de dos dormitorios). su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y tener el mejor negocio de su colonia donde vive, obtener más ganancias para sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia, 22, is married and has a son; she lives in Olanchito, Yoro.  She’s had a grocery store for almost two years where she sells basic staples like meat, rice, beans, flour, canned goods, dairy products, toilet paper, cured meats, snacks, condiments, eggs, bread, candy, basic grains and other grocery items.  

Lidia has requested a 20,000 Lempira loan to better stock the store with food items and she’ll use 10% of the loan for home improvements (she will plaster the walls in two bedrooms).  Her goal is to make the business grow and to have the best store in her neighborhood, to earn more profits and to move her family forward and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and to plaster the walls in two bedrooms at home.

loans.name: Aida Rosario

texts.es:
AIDA ROSARIO tiene 36 años de edad es soltera  no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

AIDA ROSARIO  Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, pollos, cerdos, polbillo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir trabajando en la agricultura.

El sueño es  seguir trabajando en la agricultura. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y las enfermedades en las cosechas . En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los pollos y cerdos.
texts.en:
Aida Rosario, 36, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “San Francisco” communal bank located in Recinto Pantano belonging to Ventanas Canton; they are in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Aida Rosario works in agriculture growing corn and rice and also raises animals.  She’s requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, chicks, pigs and animal feed.  With help from the loan she will be able to continue working in agriculture.

Her dream is to continue working in agriculture.  The challenge she faces is crop infestations and illnesses.  In her free time she enjoys taking care of the chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, chicks, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 31-year-old man who works as a governmental employee in day time, and in the afternoon he has a small kiosk where he sells hot drinks, mainly coffee and tea. Step by step Hussein is trying to enlarge the business and turn it into a small café, but for now he is asking for this loan to get more types of hot drinks to serve.

loans.use: to get more types of hot drinks to serve

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 32-year-old married woman. Her husband is serving in the military while she is taking care of their three children.

Alia has a small business at home selling clothing to neighbors and friends. Her business is expanding slowly by word of mouth.

Now Alia has applied for a 950 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy extra clothes and get a new collection to take advantage of the upcoming holiday season. In the future she also wants to offer housewares, too.

loans.use: to buy extra clothes to sell during the upcoming holiday season.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César de 45 años, convive con Mariza con quien tiene 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 13 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa rústica pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa. César es un hombre trabajador y responsable. Desde los 20 años se dedica a la agricultura con el cultivo de frutos.
Cuenta con terrenos propios en los que cultiva cacao, plátano y carambolas.
“El cacao los cultivo en la zona baja, porque en mi comunidad solo se producen frutas”, menciona.
Por esa razón, César se esfuerza más en su producción. Tiene que visitar casi a diario sus cultivos. Él y su esposa, se dividen las tareas agrícolas y así pueden cubrir los pedidos que los compradores les hacen.
Considera que, es más conveniente que los compradores lleguen hasta su comunidad, a que él lleve los productos hasta los mercados.
César solicita de su apoyo para adquirir abono para sus sembríos de cacao. Éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea”, y le agrada el trabajo con sus socios.
Con el dinero podrá comprar abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de cacao.
texts.en:
César is 45 years old and he lives with Mariza, his life partner, and their three children aged 20, 17 and 13. Their house is located in an indigenous community. It is rustic, but they own it. César is a responsible and hardworking man, and he has been engages in agriculture and in growing fruits since he was 20.
He owns some lands where he plants cacao, plantain and carambolas.
He says: “I plant cacao in the lower zone because fruits are the only thing produced in my community”.
For this reason, César he works hard to care for his production, having to go to the fields almost every day. He and his wife shares the farming tasks in order to succeeded in satisfying the requests they receive from their customers.
He thinks that it is more convenient for his customers to come to his community that it is for him to bring his products to the markets.
César is requesting your support to buy manure for his cacao crops. This is the 9th loan he has asked MFP, and he commits to punctually repaying the monthly dues. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea” (New Dawn for the Hamlet), and he likes working whit its other members.
Thanks to the loan he will be able to buy bags of manure to spread it over his cacao crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her cacao crops

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 50-year-old widow who is doing a tailoring business to support herself. She also does embroidery too--not only clothing items but also bed covers. She applied to this loan to buy another sewing machine and more threads and sewing tools.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa is a 42-year-old mother of six. Her husband works in one of the Jordanian courts. Fedaa is helping her husband in supporting the family, adding another source of income by selling various food products at her mini-market. Her business has helped in putting the food on the table. Now that she wants to improve the market, she applied to this loan to add more goods to the store.

loans.use: to add more goods to the store.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: Elisa tiene 50 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Amigas, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos, su esposo se dedica a la venta de dulces. Elisa comenzó vendiendo comida, refrescos y pan ya que le vendía a ayudantes y albañiles que trabajaban cerca, luego decidió iniciar con el negocio de pulpería pero prefirió cambiar de rubro ya que la pulpería no le daba muchas ganancias y actualmente se dedica a la venta de sandalias y ropa, su horario de trabajo inicia desde las 8:00 am y culmina a las 4:00 pm, trabaja en conjunto con su hijo, ellos salen a vender en su vehículo y lo hacen de forma ambulante, desde hace 10 años se dedica al negocio. El préstamo que Elisa solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de sandalias y ropa. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá tener mas surtido su negocio y con las ganancias podrá ayudar a  su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que a el le pego una enfermedad. Su sueño es poder tener su negocio más grande y bien surtido. Elisa tiene más de 5 años de recibir el apoyo de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y los préstamos obtenidos le han ayudado a mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Elisa, a member of the Solidarity Group Las Amigas, is 50 years old, married, and has four children.  Her husband works selling sweets.  Elisa started out selling food, beverages, and bread to construction workers who work close, and later decided to open a grocery store.  Most recently she has changed her business because the grocery store was not very profitable and today she works selling sandals and clothing.  She works from 8:00am to 4:00pm, and she works together with her son.  They sell their products from their car and also walking door to door, and they now have about 10 years of experience with their business.  

Elisa will use this loan to invest in more clothing and sandals. With this help she will be able to provide more variety with her products, and with her added income she will be able to help her husband with the household expenses since he has been recently diagnosed with an illness.  

Her dream is to have a larger business with greater assortment of products.  

Elisa has been a client of FAMA for over 5 years and has always made her payments on time, and the loans she has taken in the past have helped to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing and sandals to sell

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Solidaridad esta integrado por dos socios, Manuela de los Santos y Aracely del Carmen. Residen en Colonia Solidaridad en Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras. Manuela de los Santos tiene 71 anos de edad, esta casada y tiene 9 hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración de coronas de flores desde hace 28 años, oficio que aprendió con su madre. Trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche aunque ella no tiene horario de salida. No tiene mucha competencia pero cuando llueve tiene muchas dificultades. Doña Manuela invertirá el préstamo en materiales como papel y alambre para elaboración de las coronas. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han ayudado ya que hizo su vivienda y le sigue ayudando para mantener su negocio. Vive afuera de la cuidad y paga mucho transporte y padece de alta presión. Su meta es mejorar su casa y tener siempre su negocio, mejor surtido y con diferentes diseños de coronas de flores que puedan atraer más clientes. Ha sido cliente de FAMA por más de 6 años y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente. Aracely del Carmen vende frutas y verduras en el Parque Central de Juticalpa.
texts.en: Grupo Solidario Solidaridad is made up of 2 members, Manuela de los Santos and Aracely del Carmen. They live in Colonia Solidaridad in Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras. Manuela de los Santos is 71 years old, is married and has 9 children. She makes wreaths for a living and has for 28 years. She learned this trade from her mother. She works together with her children from 6 in the morning until 7 at night although she doesn't have an official ending time. She doesn't have much competition but when it rains she struggles. Doña Manuela will invest the loan in materials like paper and wire to make the wreaths. The loans that she has received have helped her build her house and continue helping her maintain her business with a better selection and different flower designs that can attract more customers. she  She lives outside the city and pays a lot for transportation and suffers from high blood pressure. Her goal is to improve her house and always have her business better stocked and with different designs of wreaths that can attract more customers. She has been a client of FAMA for more than 6 years and has complied with her payments punctually.

loans.use: to purchase paper and wire to make crowns.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal continues to buy cleaning products and detergents in bulk to rebottle into smaller, more handily-used amounts to sell to schools and homes. She is applying again for another loan from National Microfinance Bank, this time for 800 JOD to buy more bottles and cleaning products.

loans.use: to buy more bottles and cleaning products.

loans.name: Tayseer

texts.en: Tayseer is a 51-year-old father of three daughters. Being the only man with four females has given him more experience in female clothing styles, so he opened a small boutique that sells women’s clothing and dresses three years ago. He has applied for this loan for the first time to bring a new autumn and winter collection to the store to be prepared for the season and the upcoming holiday.

loans.use: to bring a new autumn and winter collection to the store

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is a 47-year-old housewife and a mother of three children. Her husband is a butcher. While he is doing his job, Khawla started a small retail business at home, selling blankets basically. Her business has helped somehow in paying some household bills and offered some allowances for her children. Now she wants to increase her profits, so she applied for this loan to bring in more bed covers in different sizes and weights.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers in different sizes and weights.

loans.name: Moises Antonio

texts.es: Don Moisés de la edad de 41 años, es soltero padre de dos hijos, es un ejemplo claro de que no existe límites de edad para la educación, estudia la carera de licenciatura en derecho, empezó a trabajar de los 16 años, ahora se desempeña como técnico en control de vectores, el solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación, para seguir preparándose para su desarrollo, mejor economía, ayudar a la familia y a la comunidad para que no le violenten sus derechos  Moisés nos dice que "hay que prepararse, que el desarrollo de una nación esta en los estudios ya que un país sin buenos profesionales llama a la miseria y pobreza."
texts.en: Moisés, 41, is a single father of two children.  He’s a clear example that there are no age limits to acquiring an education.  He’s studying Law.  He started to work at the age of 16 and now works in vector control.  He’s requesting financial help to be able to pay for his final courses in order to continue preparing for his development, to earn better income and help his family and his community so that their rights won’t be trampled upon.  Moisés says that "one has to prepare oneself; that a nation’s development depends on education because a country without good professionals is called Misery and Poverty."

loans.use: to pay for his final courses.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Suzanne est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Suzanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Suzanne est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants dont un reste à leur charge. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Suzanne mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année, la vente de nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) et divers articles dans une école du Bénin. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Suzanne sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Suzanne is 42 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She is married to a man named Pascal, with whom she has four children, one of whom is still under their care. In order to take care of her family's needs, Suzanne has been working for the past 20 years as a food vendor (rice with sauce) and diverse other products from a school in Benin. She stocks up in her region. In order to satisfy the demands of her customers and to increase her sales and profits, Suzanne is asking for her fifth loan from Alidé. This loan will allow her to increase her sales activity and achieve more profits. The first four loans were repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, firewood and condiments

loans.name: Zakiea

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Zakiea prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus, the photo is of her husband, Osama. 
 
Zakiea is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to Osama and a mother to five sons and four daughters, most of whom are school students. Her husband is a construction worker. His work is independent and stable and he earns a good income, but his salary is not enough to cover all the family's needs and the education costs.

Zakiea wants to improve her family's living condition, so she is requesting a USD loan from Faten to cover the cost of purchasing new furniture for her house, such as living room furniture and dining room furniture. Taking this loan will improve the living conditions in Zakiea's house and will offer her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Thuraya

texts.en:
Thuraya is a 55-year-old mother of four. Her husband is a plumber.

Thuraya has a good reputation and is well known among her neighbors and friends. She sells clothing as well as other special-order goods from her home.

Thuraya is applying for a 800 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy a new collection of clothes in preparation for the upcoming holiday season.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 47-year-old married woman with a four-year-old son. For the past eleven years she has sold prepaid phone cards and soft drinks like Coke.

Imelda is applying for a 30,000 PHP loan from CEVI to stock up on more prepaid calling cards and soft drinks. Her goal is to see her business thrive so she can help support her family and save for her son’s education.

loans.use: to stock up on more prepaid calling cards and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fadimata

texts.fr:
Agée de 60 ans, Madame Fadimata est mariée dans une famille polygamique et est mère de 5 enfants. Elle loge chez son mari dans le quartier Pelengana  de la ville de Ségou.
Ayant abandonnée les études depuis le second cycle (système éducatif Malien), elle s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 20 ans et très sollicitée et appréciée dans la quartier. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle adhère à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est en relation depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, elle est à son 5ème cycle de prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 60 sacs de charbon de bois avec les forains des villages environnants de Ségou.  
Madame Fadimata vend au comptant  et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra d’aider son conjoint à prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.  
Son ambition est d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Madame Fadimata is 60, in a polygamous marriage, and has five children. She lives with her husband in the Pelengana  neighbourhood of the town of Ségou.Having left school after the second cycle (in the Mali education system), she became interested at a young age in business, in particular in the buying and selling of charcoal and of firewood. She has been in this business for over 20 years. Her business is very popular and valued in the neighbourhood.
Because she needs to satisfy her increasing customer demand, she has turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institute. She has had a relationship with this institute for four years now. After properly repaying her four previous loans, she is now in her fifth individual loan cycle. She will use this loan for the purchase of 60 bags of charcoal from markets in the villages around Ségou.  
Fadimata sells for cash and credit to a clientele made up mostly of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 36 000 FCFA, which will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses.
Her goal is to buy a residential lot.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, necesita invertir mas capital en su negocio de flores artificiales, por eso esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito que le ayudara en la compra de material como flores, listones, pega, hierro, tabla, oasis, silicón y mas para la elaboración de sus  flores artificiales.
Maria nos comenta que con el préstamo anterior pudo surtir su negocio e incrementar su clientela ya que ese capital le permitió comprar material necesario para su negocio y asi poder incrementar su economía.
texts.en: María needs to invest more capital in her artificial flower business which is why she’s asking for a loan once again that will help her buy materials like flowers, ribbons, glue, wire, boards, floral foam, silicone and more to make her artificial flowers.  She comments that she was able to use her previous loan to stock her business and increase clientele because that capital helped her buy the necessary materials for her business thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy flowers, ribbons, glue, wirel, boards, floral foam and silicone.

loans.name: Olga De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Olga, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir mas en su negocio de venta de verduras, es por eso que esta solicitándonos un nuevo préstamo para la compra de tomates, chiles, papas, cebolla, güisquiles, plátanos y mas mercadería que es demandada por su clientela.
Gracias al préstamo anterior pudo mejorar e incrementar su inventario y sus ganancias económicas para la sostenibilidad de su familia, su alimentación y educación.
texts.en: Olga needs to invest more in her vegetable business which is why she’s requesting a new loan to buy tomatoes, chilies, potatoes, onions, chayote, bananas and more merchandise her customers are requesting.  The previous loan allowed her to improve and increase her inventory and profits to support her family, their food and their schooling.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilies, potatoes, onions, chayote and bananas.

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
Maria, necesita fortalecer su venta de tamales, por eso ella esta nuevamente solicitándo un crédito para la compra de elotes, aceite, leña, maíz, esto le permitirá seguir con su negocio y crecer económicamente en su familia, ya que es por esta actividad que logra mantenerse ocupada y es su ingreso principal.
Gracias al crédito anterior fortaleció su negocio y con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia a salir adelante económicamente, ella sigue manteniendo en desarrollo su negocio y mejorando cada dia.
texts.en:
María needs to strengthen her tamale sales which is why she’s once again requesting a loan to buy corn on the cob, oil, firewood and corn which will allow her to stay in business and grow economically with her family because this activity keeps her occupied and is her main source of income.

Thanks to the previous loan she strengthened her business and has ben able to help her family get ahead economically with the profits.  She continues developing the business and improving every day.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, firewood and corn on the cob.

loans.name: Katiusca Eugenia

texts.es:
Katiusca, necesita invertir en su negocio de perfumería, es por eso que de nuevo esta solicitándo un préstamo para la compra de mas perfumes, desodorantes, cremas y dos vitrinas de exhibición para su negocio y asi poder mejorar su inventario e incrementar su clientela.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo positivamente, mejorando su inventario y con ello sus ingresos económicos, ella se mantiene con el negocio para poder tener una mejor vida.
texts.en: Katiusca needs to invest in her perfumery business which is why she’s requesting a loan once more to buy more perfume, deodorants and creams as well as two display cases for her business in order to improve her inventory and increase her clientele.  Her previous loan helped her positively improving her inventory and with it her income.  She continues with her business in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and two display cases.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
Jose, esta decidido a continuar trabajando con prestamos, porque considera que son muy necesarios para facilitarle el dinero que necesita para realizar su trabajo en la agricultura, actualmente esta realizando una nueva siembra para necesitara comprar abono, semilla, pagar mozos, entre otros gastos que se le presentas, este nuevo prestamo le sera muy util.

Su experiencia con el anterior prestamo, fue positiva, ya que le ha generado en su momento lo necesario para que su cultivo presentara una buena cosecha, de la cual su familia se ha alimentado, todos se mantienen bien en su hogar, sus hijos siguen en la escuela, ha mejorado algunas partes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
José has decided to continue working with loans because he believes that they are very necessary in order to have the money he needs for his agricultural work.  He’s currently starting a new planting cycle and needs to buy manure, seeds and pay for day laborers, among other expenses he has.  This new loan will be very useful for him.

His experience with his previous loan was positive because it provided what he needed at the time so that his crop yield would be good.  His family has been fed and everyone lives well at home; the children continue in school and he’s made some improvements to parts of his house thanks to it.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and to pay for day laborers' help.

loans.name: Munkhnasan

texts.en:
Munkhnasan is 28 years old and lives with his mother and sister in a one-room apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has worked as a railroader since 2008 nonstop. His sister studies at a local university and his mother is a pensioner. His sister does part-time jobs and is now working as a waitress in a cafe in her spare time.

Munkhnasan is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to replace his old wooden windows with double-glazed new ones because his house gets colder in the wintertime due to the heat loss through the windows. As a son who loves his mother, Munkhnasan doesn’t want to let her catch cold. By doing these improvements, his house will be comfortable and warm to live in, and most importantly his house will save energy, which passes through the windows.

loans.use: To replace his old wooden windows with double-glazed new ones

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren is a 32-year-old single woman who lives with her only daughter in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant since 2007 in the transport regulation authority of the city. Her daughter studies in 4th grade in the secondary school. She has been renting a house for the last 6 years. In recent years, the house rental price has been getting expensive due to demand that exceeds supply. She said that in the end, during these years of renting a house, nothing was left for her. When the renting contract expired she used to find another house and to move. So Lhamsuren is planning to buy a plot of land in a boundary area of the city. In the future, she will build a house on her land. The loan Lhamsuren is taking out will be used to buy a plot of land which will belong to her forever.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Violeta Parra Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Violeta Parra” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de comida rápida, feriantes, vendedores ambulantes, productos para el hogar, venta de articulos de plásticos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de lo Espejo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Carla, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color rosado con rayas, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de feriante, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en ferias libres en el puesto de su madre, se dedica a vender calcetas de todos los tamaños y colores para todas las edades, su horario de trabajo es de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra gran variedad de calcetas.
Con el crédito comprará calcetas para todas las edades.
Una de las metas de Carla es surgir y crecer con su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Carla vive junto a su marido y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar y personal es tener su casa propia, y a nivel laboral darle un buen pasar a su hijo y una buena estabilidad familiar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de  la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe compromiso y responsabilidad. Respecto  a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar de mejor manera.
Lo Espejo es una  comuna ubicada en el sector surponiente de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile). Cabe destacar que es una de las comunas con más densidad poblacional del país. El crecimiento de su población comenzó con la llegada de inmigrantes provenientes de otras regiones del país en busca de mejores horizontes, en los años ´60 y ´70, dando origen a importantes poblaciones que aún se mantienen, tales como José María Caro, Santa Adriana, Lo Valledor.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Violeta Parra” consists of 17 entrepreneurs who engage in various trades. The types of businesses represented include selling fast food, managing a vending stall, traveling sales, selling household goods, selling plastic goods, service trades, and other activities. All of the members live in the community of Lo Espejo, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Carla is the Communal Bank secretary. In the photo, she is one of the people standing and is the person who is second from the right wearing a pink striped sweater. She has dark brown hair and has it pulled back.

Carla has managed a vending stall for the past two years. She says that she works at the open market where her mother has a vending stall. Carla sells socks of all sizes and colors for various ages. Her work schedule is based on when she is available. Whenever she needs merchandise, she buys from distributors and shops that have a wide variety of socks. With this loan, she will buy socks for all ages. One of Carla’s goals is to develop and grow her business so that she can generate more revenue. This will enable her to have a better quality of life.

Carla lives with her husband and their one-year-old son. Her personal dreams and those for her family include having a house of her own. With regard to her work, she hopes to do a good job of supporting her son and providing stability for her family. Carla is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable being around other entrepreneurs in her Communal Bank who are committed and responsible. She has learned how to manage her business better as a result of the training classes conducted during the meetings.

Lo Espejo is a community that is located in the southwestern section of the Metropolitana region (where the Chilean capital of Santiago is located). It should be noted that Lo Espejo is one of the most densely populated communities in Chile. The growth of its population started in the 1960s and 1970s with the arrival of immigrants from other parts of the country who were in search of better opportunities. This rise led to the establishment of important towns that exist today such as José María Caro, Santa Adriana, and Lo Valledor.

loans.use: to buy socks.

loans.name: Richard Mèhoué

texts.fr: Richard Mèhoué est âgé de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Richard Mèhoué a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau universitaire. Richard Mèhoué est marié à un certain Edwige. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, deux sont leurs propres enfants. Richard Mèhoué vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Richard Mèhoué mène comme activité depuis une douzaine d’année, l’élevage de lapins dans sa région. Richard Mèhoué s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Richard Mèhoué sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Richard Mèhoué is 39 and lives in Bénin. He attended school right up to the university level. He is married to a woman named Edwige. They have three children, some of whom are in school; two of them have their own children. Richard Mèhoué lives with his wife and children. He and his wife cover the household costs. In order to do so, Richard Mèhoué raises rabbits. He has had this business for about twelve years. Wanting to provide better customer satisfaction, and to expand his business and his income, Richard Mèhoué is requesting his third loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow him to expand his business and increase his profits. His first loans were payed off well.

loans.use: to buy rabbits, cages, and rabbit food.

loans.name: Gerber Antonio

texts.es:
Gerber, necesita invertir más capital en su negocio de carpintería, es por eso que está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de madera de cedro, aceituno, y algunas herramientas como cepilladora, cierra eléctrica circular y otras que le permitan elaborar mejor su trabajo.
El comenta que gracias al préstamo anterior pudo generar más ganancias para pagar gastos familiares, económicamente a mejorado porque cubre sus necesidades y paso a paso va creciendo y dando buen servicio con la fábrica de muebles y trabajos particulares a domicilio.
texts.en: Gerber needs to invest more capital in his carpentry business. That is why he is applying for another loan, to purchase cedar and olive wood and some tools such as a plane, an electric circular saw, and other items that will allow him to produce his work better. He comments that thanks to the past loan, he was able to generate more earnings to pay the family expenses. His economic situation has improved because he covers his needs and step by step he is growing and giving good service in the furniture factory and in special work preformed in homes.

loans.use: to buy cedar and olive wood, a plane, and an electric circular saw

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en:
Genesa, 46, is a married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has three children aged eleven, fourteen and 23 years.

For the past eight years Genesa has operated a sari-sari, or small general store, where she sells items such as biscuits, noodles, shampoo, sugar, powdered milk and soft drinks. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP from CEVI to buy more of the same sort of stock for her shop.

Genesa would like to see her business thrive so she can support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila, 25, is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Ahmad, appears in this Kiva profile photo. She is married to Ahmad and is the mother of a two-year-old son.

Ahmad is a construction worker who has a good reputation among his customers. It has been a profitable line of work and but he needs more support from time to time to cover his business and family expenses.

Laila wants to help her husband in this regard, so she is applying for a 1,000 USD loan from Faten to help her husband to buy additional lumber for his work. Taking this loan will help Laila's husband as well as increase the family's income and better its living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more lumber.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a 35-year-old woman who is married and a mother to three sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary. Leena lives in Al-Mghayier village near Jenin city, which is an agricultural village famous for its vegetable and olive crops. For the past three years, Leena has had a project of raising poultry and she wants to purchase new pan-feeding and nipple-drinking systems, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $1,200 from FATEN. When Leena gets the loan, she will be able to pay for purchasing the new pan-feeding and nipple-drinking systems for the poultry she is raising. In this way, she will improve her project and increase her income to provide better life conditions to the family. 

Leena and her youngest son are photographed in the poultry farm she has.

loans.use: To purchase new pan-feeding and nipple-drinking systems

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, necesita invertir más en el cultivo de maíz y de frijol, es por eso que él está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de abono y herbicidas, para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz y frijol y así poder tener un mejor cultivo prevenido de plagas.
Concepción, manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior compro fertilizantes para el cultivo de la primera cosecha y así garantizó la alimentación de su familia, él sigue con su cultivo y espera seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
Concepción needs to invest more in the cultivation of corn and beans, and that's why he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides, to apply them to the cultivation of corn and beans and therefore have a better crop, preventing pests.

Concepción says he bought fertilizer for the cultivation of his first crop with his previous loan. With it, he ensured to feed her family. He continues with the cultivation and hopes to keep improving.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastasia, necesita  invertir en su negocio, por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra de maíz, quesillo, tomates, chiles, cebollas, gas y más cosas para su negocio, con ello podrá surtirlo y tener a la mano lo necesario para preparar la venta de pupusas y tortillas, sirviendo más a sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo en la compra de materia prima para su negocio, así pudo mejorar también sus ingresos económicos para seguir sosteniendo su hogar.
texts.en: Anastasia needs to invest in her business which is why she’s once again requesting a loan to buy corn, string cheese, tomatoes, chilies, onions, gas and other things for her business.  With it she’ll be able to stock it and have what she needs to make pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] and tortillas on hand thus serving more customers.  The previous loan helped her to buy raw materials for her business improving her income to continue supporting her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, string cheese, tomatoes, chilies, onions and gas.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tienen tres hijos de 1, 3 y 5 años, vive con los suegros, Julia se dedica a la compra de cerdos para reventa, tiene dos años de estar en este negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un cerdo y también concentrado, este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar su granja y poder tener facilidades de venta.
Su objetivo con el crédito es tener más cerdos en la granja, aprovechar para hacer una buena compra, con su familia espera mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: Julia, 23, lives with her husband; they have three children who are 1, 3 and 5 years old.  She lives with her parents-in-law.  Julia works buying pigs to resell.  She’s been in this business two years and it started on her own initiative.  She’s requesting a loan to buy a pig and also to buy feed.  This loan will help her increase her herd size and have more to sell.  Her goal with the loan is to have more pigs in her farm and to take advantage of it to make a good purchase; she also expects to improve her family’s economic condition.

loans.use: to buy a pig and feed.

loans.name: Ndiaw

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndiaw est un jeune tailleur qui exerce le métier depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Il a tout le temps pour s’occuper de son activité de couture car il est célibataire sans enfant. Il vient solliciter pour la 3ème fois un crédit de 125000 F CFA pour l’acquisition d’une machine piqueuse afin de préparer la fête de Tabaski. Cette fête qui est la plus importante du calendrier  musulman, prend une grande envergure dans le domaine de la mode : pratiquement toutes les couches sociales renouvellent leur garde robe pour bien préparer la fête. C’est d’ailleurs dans ce cadre que Ndiaw veut augmenter sa productivité en achetant une machine et dans ce cas il pourra satisfaire la demande. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Dans l’avenir, il aimerait acquérir plusieurs machines pour augmenter sa production et ouvrir un grand atelier de confection.
texts.en: Mr Ndiaw is a young man that has been working as a tailor for the past ten years. As a single man without children, he has a lot of time to spend on his profession. He is asking for a third loan of 125,000 FCFA (~250 USD) in order to purchase a sewing machine with a step pedal in order to prepare for the upcoming Tabaski festival. This is the largest annual muslim festival, and is practiced around the world. Nearly all people purchase new clothes for the festival, regardless of social class. In anticipation of this, Ndiaw wants to increase his productivity by purchasing a machine, in order to satisfy his customer's demands. He takes care of the daily needs of his family. In the future, he would like to purchase several machines to further increase his productivity and open a workshop.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine for his usage

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane est très top entré dans la cadence de la vie active. Il fait de l’agriculture depuis 40 ans maintenant. Ousmane est mariée et père de famille. C’est avec les bénéfices de son activité, qu’il réussi à prendre en charge les dépenses quotidienne de sa famille. Il est à son 4ème crédit et il demande un montant de 400000F CFA pour acheter des semences de choux, de l’engrais et des machines pour améliorer son exploitation. Monsieur Ousmane commence sa journée à 8h et la fini à 18 h de l’après midi. Avec le crédit, elle pourra épargner et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Comme projets futurs, il souhaiterait acheter une motopompe de puissance élevée pour faire face à ses activités.
texts.en:
Monsieur Ousmane started working at a very young age. He has been a farmer for fourty years now. Ousmane is a married father. He covers his family's daily costs with his income from farming. This is his fourth loan, and he is requesting 400000F CFA to buy cabbage seeds, fertilizer, and machines for improving his farm. Ousmane starts his day at 8:00 am and finishes work at 6:00 pm. With this loan, he will be able to feed his family and improve their nutrition.
As a project for the future, he hopes to buy a motorized elevated pump for his work.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seed, fertilizer, and machines for improving crops.

loans.name: Clotilde Alejandrina

texts.es:
CLOTILDE ALEJANDRINA tiene 71 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija vive con el conyugue y la hija en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

CLOTILDE ALEJANDRINA Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, cerdos, polbillo, alanceado.

Con la ayuda del crédito tendra la oportunidad de comprar los pollos y los cerdos para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos. El sueño es  seguir trabajando para obtener mejores ingresos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades que les dan a los animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar y alimentar a los pollos y cerdos
texts.en:
Clotilde Alejandrina, 71, is in a free civil union and has a daughter.  She lives with her spouse and daughter in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “San Francisco” communal bank located in Recinto Pantano belonging to Ventanas Canton; they are in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Clotilde Alejandrina works in agriculture growing corn and also raises chickens and pigs.  She’s requesting the loan to guy chicks, pigs and animal feed.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy chicks and piglets to raise, fatten up and then sell.  Her dream is to continue working to earn higher income.

The challenge she faces is the illnesses the animals can contract.  In her free time she enjoys caring for and feeding the chicks and pigs.

loans.use: to buy chicks, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Jazmín” las integrates decidieron el nombre ya que en la casa donde se reunen esta un cuadro hermosos de jazmines el grupo está integrado por mujeres trabajadoras todas ella se dedican al comercio y todas han solicitado el crédito para invertir en su negocio. 

Florentina comprará maíz para sus tortillas
Margarita invertirá en su taller de costura
Maribel comprará sabanas y colchas para vender
Jazmín comprará pollos y guajolotes para cría y venta 
Lizbeth Crisostomos vende guajolotes comprara pequeños para crecerlos y luego criarlos
María Elena, Rosalía y Lizbeth compraran borregos 
Antonia comprara pollos y guajolotes 
Ma Maura invertira en lenceria
Leticia, Mirna y Beatriz invertiran en ropa 
Mayra invertirá en su estética
Alicia invertirá en su negocio de material de construcción


Doña Alicia tiene 56 años de edad es viuda ya no tiene dependientes ella era del Distrito Federal, pero ahora esta viviendo en la comunidad, platica que tiene una casa de materiales que inició su esposo en el año de 1983 y la inicio porque era albañil y conocía de todo tipo de materiales como cemento, cal, varillas, tabique, etc. Es por eso que esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar todo lo que le hace falta como cal, cemento, varillas, armes, etc., ya tiene un proveedor seguro que le da precio cada vez que hace una compra por mayoreo. Además, explica que no tiene ningún tipo de dificultad solo cuando los precios suben demasiado pero no es gran problema porque sabe que así como sube también baja en cualquier momento. Doña Alicia comenta “No tengo una meta en sí, no me gustaría tener otro negocio solo me gustaría que el que tengo ahora en la actualidad siga operando.”
texts.en:
The members of “Jazmín” group chose this name because in the house where they gather to talk about their loans there is a beautiful picture of jasmine flowers. The group is composed of hard-working women; all of whom run trade businesses and they all requested a loan to invest in their activities. 

Florentina will buy maize to keep preparing tortillas, Margarita will invest in her tailor’s shop, Maribel will buy bed sheets and quilts to sell, Jazmín will buy chicken and turkeys to raise, Lizbeth Crisostomos will buy young turkeys, María Elena, Rosalía and Lizbeth will buy sheep, Antonia chicken and turkeys, Ma Maura will buy underware, Leticia, Mirna and Beatriz will buy clothes, Mayra will invest in her beauty salon and Alicia will invest in her business of building material. 

Alicia is 56 years old, she lost her husband some time ago and she no longer has any under-age children depending on her. She used to live in Mexico City, but now she is living in a community in the State of Mexico. Her husband was the one who began the building material business in 1983 because she worked as a brick layer and he had a lot of experience related to this type of products such as cement, lime, metal oil, bricks, etc. Alicia is requesting a new loan to buy all the material she still needs to restock the store. Alicia already has a supplier who offers a better price if she buys a larger quantity of material. The difficulty in this type of business is still the price of the material, but she knows that just as it tends to rise, there are seasons when she can find good prices. Doña Alicia mentioned: “I don’t have a goal, I would not like to change my activity, I just want this one to keep operating.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Felix Ivan

texts.es: Félix, 42 años de edad, es un humilde campesino, originario de la comarca San Lorenzo en las afueras de Teustepe. El siembra frijoles y maíz que son cultivos propios de la zona. Su esposa es ama de casas y de sus  4 hijos 2 trabajan con el sembrando, el otro vive aparte y el menor estudia un curso de mecánica. Don Felix tiene 22 años de trabajar en la siembra , sus inicios fueron difíciles ya que solo poseía una pequeña parcela de tierra y un mozo. Poco a Poco ha ido mejorando su casa y comprando animales. Pues desea tener ganado de raza para criar y vender. El esta solicitando el crédito para comprar una vaquilla, su proyecto continuar con el ciclo de siembra, cancelar su préstamo y tener su crianza de animales.
texts.en: Félix is 42 years old, he is a simple farmer and a native of the rural area of San Lorenzo, located in the outskirts of Teustepe. He plants beans and corn, endemic crops of his area. His wife is a housewife and 2 of his 4 children work with him, one lives on his own, while the youngest is studying to become a mechanic. Félix has been engaging in agriculture for 22 years; he has had a difficult start as he only possessed a small lot of land and one helper. Little by little he has made improvements to his house and he has bought animals, as he wants to own thoroughbred cattle to breed and sell. He is requesting a loan to buy a heifer. He plans on continuing with his sowing cycles, pay off his loan and start his animal breeding activity.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: The rising costs of agrochemical fertilizers are making it increasingly harder for Esther (pictured with her son) and her son to continue farming tomatoes. In order to become more competitive, she is constantly looking for solutions to decrease her expenses. With her 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and the waste from her cows and turkeys, she will become fully self-sufficient in organic fertilizer production. She will also use the biogas generated by the system to displace LP gas consumption in the kitchen and her boiler. This Kiva loan is for 51% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.en: Well-known locally for the quality of their produce, José Gregorio (pictured on the left with his three sons) and his family want to reduce their production costs. Their 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow them to completely supplant expensive agrochemical fertilizer with the waste produced by his cows and pigs. The resultant potent organic fertilizer will be used on his maize, wheat, and squash crops. The biodigester will also produce biogas allowing him to reduce the use of non-renewable LP Gas in cooking and heating bathwater. This Kiva loan represents 68% of the total value of his system.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 48 years old and from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has six children aged eight to 21 years.

For ten years now Antonina has grown and sold rice to help support her family. She is applying for a 6,000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy fertilizer for her crops. She is confident of the healthy impact this will have on her fields and her yield at harvest.

Antonina will use her profits on her family’s daily needs and school fees. She feels that through the loan she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: FIFA est un groupement de dix sept personnes, dont les membres exercent leurs activités au même endroit. La représentante du groupe, Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un policier du nom Paul. Marie est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure ensemble les diverses charges du mébage. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a dix ans environs que Marie mène comme activité la vente de riz et de divers produits dans une école publique du Bénin et à son domicile. Marie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement FIFA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
FIFA is a group of 17 people, all of whom work in the same place. The group representative, Marie (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 47 and married to a policeman named Paul. Marie has three children, all in school, whom she takes care of. She and her husband live together with their children and both work to cover the household costs. On top of their own children, the couple has another child to take care of. Marie did not attend school.
For approximately ten years, Marie has sold rice and various products at a public school in Bénin and from her home. Marie works passionately. Her work allows her to provide for her needs and those of her children. Marie gets her products from a market in Bénin. In order to better satisfy her customers, Marie is requesting her first loan, along with her fellow group members from FIFA. This loan will allow them to better serve their customers and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and various products.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino is 32 years old and a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been fishing for eighteen years now. So far, this livelihood has been profitable except when the weather is not conducive to fishing activities.

Catalino is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan from CEVI so he can buy a new engine for his fishing boat. This will be a great help since his existing engine needs fixing. He hopes that someday he can also buy a new fishing boat, expand his fishing business and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Fleur D' Amitie 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Edouard est le coordinateur de son groupe Fleur d. Amitie, ils vivent dans la région  Ouanaminthe,  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Edouard est un commercant. 

Il a dirigé son  commerce de artisant pendant 5 années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce il était un etudiant. Edouard voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit divers avec cosmetiques, vetement, chaussures, etc. Il espère que cet emprunt l'aidera à agrandir son business. Eouard dit que les  défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.

Edouard dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un  gros business avec son  fond et par la  grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Edouard is the coordinator of the Fleur D'Amitie group. The members all live in the region of Ouanaminthe, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Edouard is a retailer.
He has had his business for five years. Before going into business, he was a student. Edouard would like to use this loan to invest in various products; cosmetics, clothing, shoes, etc. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Edouard says that his main challenge is to become a big businessman.
Edouard says that his main goal and dream is to have a large business through his own work and the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 41 years old from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children and relies on her sari-sari store business for an income. Her business sells basic household commodities like seasoning, toiletries, sugar, coffee, milk and detergent to the people in her community. This has been her source of livelihood for two years now. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver to help in raising their children. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, noodles, canned goods and detergent. The loan will be a great help so she can further improve her sales and business profits. In the future, she hopes to offer more items that she has not previously carried and help her business grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, canned goods, detergent and toiletries

loans.name: Eugénie Aniouvi

texts.fr: Eugénie Aniouvi est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Eugénie Aniouvi est mariée à Nathanaèl, un éléveur. Eugénie Aniouvi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Eugénie Aniouvi mène comme activité depuis une quarantaine d’année, la vente des charbons de bois et divers dans une école du Bénin. Eugénie Aniouvi s’approvisionne dans des villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Eugénie Aniouvi sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Eugénie Aniouvi is 56 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to Nathanaèl, who works in agriculture. They live together, along with their children, and together take care of the needs of the family. In order to take care of the needs of her family, Eugénie Aniouvi has been selling firewood and other items from a school, and stocks up on merchandise in several cities in Benin. In order to satisfy the demands of her customers and to increase her sales, she is asking for her fourth loan from Alidé. This loan will allow her to increase her level of activity and achieve greater profits. The first three loans were reimbursed in a timely manner.

loans.use: purchase firewood and diverse merchandise

loans.name: Fotouh

texts.en:
Fotouh is a 44-year-old housewife. She is the mother of two sons.

The family’s basic source of income comes from the husband’s work as a mechanic. But since Fotouh wants to improve their living conditions, she has started buying and selling blankets from home.

Now that she is building up customers through her neighbors and friends, Fotouh wants to increase the number of blankets she has and sell more types of bed covers. She also wants to make a small storage room for her merchandise. For these reasons she is applying for this 600 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and make a small storage room for them.

loans.name: Inshirah

texts.en:
Inshirah is 43 years old and divorced. She has a tailoring business that she depends on to support herself. In her workshop she either mends ripped clothes or designs new ones to sell.

Now Inshirah has applied for this 500 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy more fabric and thread. She expects to increase her productivity and so increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread.

loans.name: Jesugnon 6 Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON 6 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Floride (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvain. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Floride vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges des enfants. Floride n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quinze années que Floride mène comme activité la vente de divers articles et des charbons de bois à son domicile afin de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage. Floride exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Floride s’approvisionne dans certains régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Floride sollicite un sixième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON 6. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: JESUGNON 6 is a group of three people. The members are friends who live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, Floride (who is raising her hand in the picture), is 43 and married to a man named Sylvain. The couple has five children, some of whom are in school, all of whom are under their care. Floride lives with her husband and children. The couple shares childcare duties. Floride did not go to school. She has sold coal and various items from her home for fifteen years now in order to contribute to the household costs. Floride is passionate about her work, since it helps her to provide for her children and for herself. She gets her products in various regions of Bénin. In order to provide better customer service, Floride and her fellow JESUGNON 6 group members are requesting a sixth loan. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to make better profits. Their previous loans were paid back well.

loans.use: to buy bags of coal and various items.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 43-year-old housewife. Her husband works in a construction business while she takes care of their two children. To help in supporting the family, Hanaa started a small home-based retail business that sells blankets and bed covers. She applied for this loan to increase her profits by getting more blankets to prepare for the winter season.

loans.use: To get more blankets and bed covers

loans.name: El Chadi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EL CHADI est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et appartiennent à une même association d’artisans. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Gisèle, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mariée à un certain Mèdénoukoun, Gisèle est âgée de 30 ans. Gisèle est mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et se partage, les diverses charges de la maison. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a cinq années que Gisèle exerce comme activité, la coiffure dans son quartier. Secondairement, Gisèle vend des mèches et des bijoux dans son atelier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Gisèle s’approvisionne dans au Nigeria et au Togo. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Gisèle désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Gisèle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EL CHADI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The EL CHADI group is made up of three people who are friends and who belong to the same artisans' association. The group representative, Gisèle, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. This is the second time that the group has requested a loan from ALIDé. Their foal is to expand their businesses. Gisèle is 30 and married to a man named Mèdénoukoun. They have two children, both of whom are under their care and one of whom is in school. They live together with their children and share the household costs. Gisèle did not go to school. She has been a hairdresser for five years. As a secondary activity, she sells hairpieces and jewellery in her workshop. This allows her to cover her needs without great difficulty. She gets her products from Nigeria and Togo. In order to better respond to customer demand, Gisèle wants to strengthen and diversify her business. In order to do so, she and her fellow EL CHADI group members are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their first loan was paid off well.

loans.use: to buy hairpieces and jewellery.

loans.name: Lovely Mae

texts.en:
Lovely Mae is 26 years old and from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with a four-year-old little girl.

For two years now Lovely Mae and her husband have fished for a living. She is applying for a 4,000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy a new fishing net to replace their old one. She is optimistic that this will be an advantage as far as being more productive at sea.

Lovely Mae hopes to see their business thrive so she can provide for a better future for her family, especially for her child's future education.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 59 years old and from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three grown children.

For the past ten years Crispina has operated a sari-sari, or a small general store, in her community. She sells grocery items like rice, canned goods, toiletries and seasoning. Her business earns her an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP.

Crispina is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy more sugar and food for her shop, as she always runs out of these items. Her loan would mean a lot as far as growing her business.

Crispina hopes to see her business thrive so she can save and live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and food to sell.

loans.name: Lucia Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia  tiene 20 años y es soltera, ella  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos a crédito, desde carne, ají molido hasta televisores, batidoras, licuadoras, etc. esto debido a que la gente no puede comprar sus productos al contado y se hace mas fácil ir pagando de a poco,  su domicilio se encuentra en  la zona la Merced, ahí tiene la mercadería que reparte, este préstamo es el segundo que ha tomado dentro la institución, la Sra. Lucia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de mercadería y también abrirá una tienda donde pueda exhibir sus productos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo ya que tiene pedidos que entregar, la Sra. Lucia enfrenta retos en su negocio que como el que hay algunos clientes que no pagan, lo que hace que ella no pueda traer mas mercadería para poder atender a otros clientes que necesitan sus productos, va a utilizar los beneficios comprara ají molido por mayor, para poder distribuir de mejor manera  y mejorar sus ingresos. Su deseo para  su negocio es quiere que su negocio crezca y poder ayudar a más personas que no cuentan con el efectivo disponible para poder comprar sus productos y fomentar a que de a poco vayan haciendo sus propios bienes, ya que esta es la satisfacción que tiene la Sra. ver  a sus clientes felices.
texts.en: Mrs. Lucia is 20 years old and single.  She makes a living selling all kinds of products on credit, from meat and ground garlic to televisions, blenders, mixers, etc..  This is due to the fact that people can't buy their products in cash and find it easier to pay in installments.  Her residence is in the Merced zone, and this is where she has the merchandise that she sells.  This is her second loan with this organization.  Mrs. Lucia will use this loan to purchase a variety of merchandise and will also open a store where she can display her products.  Her reason for needing this loan is the lack of cash and needing to fill orders.  Mrs. Lucia faces challenges in her business as in customers that do not pay, which causes her not to be able to get merchandise to other customers that need her products.  She will use the proceeds to buy ground garlic at wholesale and be able to sell it and improve her income.  Her wishes are for her business to grown and be able to give more help to the people that don't have cash available to purchase the products they need this way encouraging them to slowly begin making their own goods.  She gets a lot of satisfaction in seeing her customers happy.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and also to open a store where she can display her products.

loans.name: Said Gerzan

texts.es: El joven Said de 23 años de edad, estudiante de la carrera de ingeniería civil, siendo su mayor sueño ser un profesional exitoso, ponerse al servicio ante la sociedad y en especial a su familia. Por tal motivo solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación, ya que de no ser posible se truncarían sus sueños y obligadamente hubiese recurrido a familiares o amigos para el préstamo, el piensa y comparte que financiar y apoyar a la formación de los jóvenes es la mejor inversión para el beneficio de la sociedad.
texts.en: This young adult Said Gerzan, is a 23 year old civil engineering student. His biggest dream is to be a successful professional, and to help society, especially his family. For these reasons he is requesting this loan in order to pay for the final fees to receive his diploma. If this is not possible his dreams will be cut short and he will have to turn to his relatives or friends for the loan. He believes that financing and supporting education for youth is the best investment for the benefit of society.

loans.use: to pay for his graduation course fees.

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
Munkhzul is 40 years old and lives with his family in a rental house, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Munkhzul has two sons, ages 17 & 13 who are studying in a secondary school. Munkhzul has been selling spare parts of machines since 2011. His business is going well. His wife doesn’t have a job, so he is the one who brings income for his family. So many problems are waiting for him to solve them like owning a house, paying tuition fees for his boys and expanding his business. 

He usually sells spare parts of light cars. In the developing mining sector of Mongolia, construction work is flourishing in every corner of the city and heavy lorries interlace through the city by carrying heavy loads. With hopes that“big money will give high yield”, he is planning to sell spare part of heavy lorries because they are much more expensive than light cars. So, Munkhzul is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to raise his current assets and to buy spare parts of heavy lorries to raise his income.

loans.use: to raise his current assets and to buy spare parts of heavy lorries to sell and raise his income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use towards marketing her new business

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Estrella de Belén tiene 8 integrantes, de los cuales son 7 mujeres y un hombres. Estos integrantes están en las edades comprendidas de 25, 60 anos. Con 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del municipio de Malpaisillo  lugar que esta ubicado en la zona sur  del país. Los integrantes de Estrella de Belén  son personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. En caso de Francisca  Yanet es la coordinadora del banco Estrella de Belén la cual se encarga de buen funcionamiento y la responsabilidad de los integrantes del grupo en cuanto a los pagos en tiempo y forma. Francisca tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. El negocio consisten en vender granos básicos al por mayor y menudeado como arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, jabón, detergente, sal, fosforo. La rutina de esta mujer es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir un poco más su  negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus  clientes. Francisca Yanet agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Estrella de Belén Communal Bank has eight members, seven women and one men between the ages of 25 and 60.  They have 10 dependent children in their care and are natives of the town of Malpaisillo, located in the southern part of the country.  They're responsible and hardworking people who want to improve themselves personally.

As the coordinator of Estrella de Belén Bank, Francisca Yanet is in charge of the smooth running of the bank and ensuring the members' responsibility in making their payments.

Francisca's job is selling basic necessities in a specific location in town.  The business entails bulk and retail sales of basic staples such as rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, soap, detergent, salt, and matches.  Her routine is to work about 10 hours a day.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business a bit more to satisfy customer demand.

Francisca Yanet is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a means to a life of dignity.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, soap, detergent, salt, and matches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional men's, women's, and kids' shoes

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a thirty-one-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has three children ages seven, four and three years old. She has been in the buy and sell business for almost one year. She sells various blouses, t-shirts and pants. Her husband is a security guard and helps her finance their family needs. 

She has requested a loan of 4,000PHP to buy various blouses, pants and t- shirts. In the future, Sally would like expand her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy various blouses, pants and t-shirts to sell for her business.

loans.name: Martha Ninoska

texts.es:
La señora Martha Ninoska trabaja para un golegio del municipio de la paz centro, desde hace 9 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y tres hijos brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar.

solicita  a ceprodel un crédito para mejora de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo y separación de cuartos y cocina con la compra de zinc, cemento, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra para otorgarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
en la foto Martha esta impartiendo clase en la aula a los niños de 4 a 6 años edad en tercer nivel
texts.en:
Señora Martha Ninoska has worked as a primary teacher for a city school in La Paz Centro for 9 years. With this job she has raised her family, which consists of herself and three children, offering them schooling, food, and the other basic household necessities.

She is applying to CEPRODEL for a loan to improve her home by repairing the roof and separating the rooms and the kitchen. She will buy zinc roofing, cement, and bricks, and pay for labor in order to offer better living conditions to her children.

In the photo, Martha is giving lessons in the schoolroom to children ages 4 to 6 at the third level.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as brick, galvanized roofing, cement, and other items

loans.name: Pedro Jorge

texts.es:
Pedro Jorge tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos el vive con la conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la América, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol, gandul.

Pedro Jorge se dedica  a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, abonos orgánicos, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para la agricultura. Las compras de los productos lo hará en Ventanas o en Mocache.

El sueño es comprarse una finca. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar los cultivos.

“Esta muy agradecida por el crédito anterior”.
texts.en:
Pedro Jorge is 42 years old. From a common-law marriage he has two children. He lives with his partner and the children in the city of Ventanas, Rios Province.

He is a member of VRC Unidos Venceremos. It is located in the Precinct La América, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. Ventanilla specializes in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, beans, and gandul beans. 

Pedro Jorge works in agriculture in the cultivation of corn. He is applying for the loan to buy urea, insecticides, organic fertilizers, and liquid weed-killer. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers for agriculture. He will purchase the products in Ventanas or in Mocache.

The dream is to buy a farm. The challenges that he faces are pests in the crops. In his free time, he likes to take care of the crops.

He is very thankful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, organic fertilizer, liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Filadelfa

texts.en:
Filadelfa is a 63-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is thirty four years old.

She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for fifteen years. She sells soft drinks, coffee, canned goods and sugar. Filadelfa plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise to sell like soft drinks, coffee, sugar and canned goods. In the future, Filadelfa would like to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks, coffee, canned goods and sugar.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 2 Group

texts.es:
Don Natividad tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos en el municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y tiene más de 30 años de tener sus propios cultivos. Cosecha maíz, frijoles, papas y tomate. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local.  Don natividad pertenece al grupo llamado Nuevo Renacer 2, que está formado por 4 miembros, todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de papa. Han estado juntos en  cuatro ciclos de préstamos con el actual. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta María, seguido esta Ángel, don Natividad y a la derecha se encuentra Eusebio.
El préstamo grupal suma 35,000 Lempiras, y lo han solicitado para siembra de papa, compraran todo el insumo necesario para dicho cultivo. Dice que los préstamos le han sido de mucha ayuda para darles buena asistencia a los cultivos logrando así buena producción de calidad.
