Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en las cosechas. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de paseo a la playa junto a la familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Ruperto is 44 years old and is in a de facto relationship. He has two children and lives with the children and his wife in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the San Francisco communal bank which is located in the Pantano district. It belongs to the Ventanas Canton. Their businesses are based on agriculture and livestock. 

Francisco Ruperto works in agrigulture, sowing corn and also raising chickens and pigs.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, chickens, nutritional feed, urea and insecticides. With the help of this loan he can improve his income. He will make the purchases Ventanas. His dream is to continue working and investing to obtain a better income from his products.  

The challenges he faces are the plagues which affect his crops. In his free time he likes to go to the beach with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chickens, nutritional feed, urea and insecticides.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 51 years old. She is married and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of items to sell in her general store.
Alma has been in this business for seven years, and she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, soap, and soft drinks.
In the future, Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Faaluaina

texts.en:
Faaluaina is a 31 year old and married, with one child.

She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Faaluaina  has requested a loan to buy more chemicals, fertilizers, weed spray, shovels, picks, and barbed wire. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Faaluaina hopes for the betterment of her family and her kid's future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers, shovels, picks, weed spray, and barbed wire

loans.name: Atinae

texts.en: Atinae is 46 years old. She is single and has one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. Atinae has requested a loan to buy more supplies needed for her business such as a gas burner, sacks of flour, sugar, frying pans, and tongs. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Atinae will save her profits for her child's education and for her family commitments.

loans.use: to buy a gas burner, sacks of flour, sugar, frying pans, and tongs.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is 28 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Michel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Michel has been raising pigs for five years, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en:
Asiasiga is 53 years old, is married and has six children. She has a small garden in which she grows fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, peas, cabbage, lettuce and oranges which she sells to the community. Asiasiga requests a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, bush knives, fertilizer, weed killer spray, and more seedlings. 

Asiasiga has been a member of SPBD since 2011 and joined to gain access to financial stability. In the future, Asiasiga hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for her garden.

loans.name: Laulauatumua

texts.en: Laulauatumua is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Laulauatumua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, weed spray, a saw chain, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Laulauatumua hopes to save up for her business needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, weed spray, a saw chain, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Crisales works hard to support her family.
She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Crisales is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items to sell in her general store.
Crisales has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aitogi

texts.en: Aitogi is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Aitogi has requested a loan to buy more chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, picks and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Aitogi hopes to save up for her children's education and betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, picks, weed spray and a spade.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 46 years old and married, with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosario is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosario has been farming rice for eight years, and she also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling live crab and shrimp in the Philippines.
She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of crab and shrimp to sell.
Angeline has been in this business for five years. Angeline earns other income from farming sugarcane.
Angeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of crab and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Faapototosoo

texts.en:
Faapotopotosoo is 65 years old and married, with seven children. 

She has a small business, making and selling  u'a leaves to make siapo (tapa cloth) in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy equipment such as a carving knife, a wheelbarrow, paint, paint brushes, scissors, and so forth. 

In the future, Faapotopotosoo hopes to build her family a fixed house and see her children through college. She is a new member of SPBD this year and joined to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy paint, paint brushes, carving knives, and scissors.

loans.name: Hanzel

texts.en: Hanzel is 39 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Hanzel is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Hanzel has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from buy & sell dried fish. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru: Игорь торгует на рынке в городе Мелитополь уже пять лет. Он продает спортивную одежду. Лучше всего продаются спортивные куртки и костюмы. Впрочем, в бизнесе Игоря есть сезонность. Летом идет спад торговли, а осенью и зимой - улучшение. В данный момент Игорь видит повышенный спрос на его товар и намерен развивать свой бизнес дальше. Игорь просит предоставить ему кредит для закупки зимней спортивной одежды. На полученную прибыль планирует улучшить свои бытовые условия.
texts.en: Igor has been working as a vendor at the Melitopol town market for five years. He sells sports clothing. Sports jackets and suits are especially in demand. However, there are seasonal factors. In the summer, sales  slow down, and in the fall and winter, sales pick up again. At present, facing an increased demand for his goods, Igor   intends to grow his business further. Igor is asking for a loan to stock up on winter sports clothing. He plans to use the resulting revenues to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on winter sports clothing.

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en: Ma. Ruby is 37 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Ruby is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. Ma. Ruby has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending as well as buy & sell livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Diosa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling nipa, which are woven palm mats used in the Philippines for house construction and repair.  She also earns additional income from swine fattening. 

Diosa is borrowing PHP 28,500 through NWTF to buy more nipa to sell in her nipa business.

Diosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to sell.

loans.name: Mahukpego 10 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKPEGO 10 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Machoucoura (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Sikirou. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés. Machoucoura et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Machoucoura n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a vingt ans environs que, Machoucoura mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (glacières, assiettes et plastiques) de façon ambulante. Machoucoura exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Machoucoura s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Machoucoura sollicite un sixième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 10. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mahukpego 10 is a group of three individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Machoucoura (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 40 years old. Her husband’s name is Sikirou. They have four children, some of whom are in school. Machoucoura and her husband live together with their children and jointly provide for various household needs. Machoucoura never attended school. For about 20 years, Machoucoura has been selling various products (coolers, dishes and plastic items) as a street vendor. She is dedicated to this work, which allows her to provide for herself and her children. Machoucoura stocks up in a town of Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Machoucoura, along with the other members of  her group, is seeking her sixth loan. This loan will allow group members to better meet demand and increase their profits. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy coolers, dishes and plastic items.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa mats, which are woven palm mats used for house repair and construction, in the Philippines.
She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa mats to sell.
Brenda has been in this business for 26 years. Brenda earns other income from a general store.
Brenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa mats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic bags, sugar, flour, yeast, dripping oil, and a gas oven.

loans.name: Osiris Odir

texts.es: Osiris Odir de veinticinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo en una vivienda muy acojedora, Osiris quien fue muy bien referenciado es una persona muy responsable, un joven muy emprendedor a quien le gusta trabajar muy vivaz, es  de mucho respeto por sus conocidos por lo cual obtuvo muy buenas referencias trabaja con granos básicos, como jornalero y en la corta de café, cultiva en una de las mayores zonas de producción del frijol y todo lo que produce lo comercia en diferentes zonas de la comunidad, aumento la demanda por lo que le solicita INTEGRAL un crédito que le permítala compra de los insumos para  una buena fertilización del frijol ya que este se encuentra en muy buenas condiciones y presenta un buen follaje, que le permitiría obtener el mayor provecho de  esta cosecha  y aumentar sus ganancias en lo que cree ha sido una muy buena siembra y puede utilizar el crédito para mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia y asegura poder cubrir el valor de el préstamo.
texts.en: Osiris Odir, 25 years old, lives with his life partner and son in a very welcoming home.  Osiris, who was well referenced, is a very responsible person and a very enterprising young man who likes to work very vivaciously.  He is well respected by his acquaintances from whom he got very good references.  He works with basic grains, as a day laborer, and in coffee harvesting; farming in one of the major production zones for beans.  Everything he produces he sells in different areas of his community.  The demand increased which is why he asks INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy the supplies to well fertilize the beans because this way they will be in good condition and yield good foliage, which would allow him to get the best out of this harvest and increase his profits from what he believes has been a very good crop.  And he can use the loan to improve the quality of life for himself and his family, and he is sure that he can cover the value of the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seed, insecticide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Erica Marisol

texts.es: Érica Marisol vive con su compañero de vida en una casa alquilada a la cual acaban de mudarse, ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora así como también posee una excelente historia de pagos cancelados de sus deudas. Érica se encarga de cultivar granos básicos, maíz y  frijol, junto con su familia en una parcela que es propicia para el cultivo de estos, comercia en los diferentes alrededores de la comunidad, y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente, para esta siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee de capital por eso se solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la adquisición de semilla de maíz, frijol, así como abonos, fertilizantes etc. Asegura completar los pagos establecidos del crédito otorgado que será utilizado como una inversión para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Érica Marisol lives with her life partner in a rented house which they just moved into. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman, and she also has an excellent record of paying her debts. Érica works growing basic grains, rice and beans, together with her family, on a plot of land that is favorable for growing these crops. She sells her products in various areas around her community, and she already has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from her because of the quality of her products, her good prices and her excellent service. For this planting season she wants to increase her production, but she does not have the capital, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy corn and bean seeds, as well as fertilizers, compost, etc. She promises to make her payments on schedule for the loan granted to her, which will be used as an investment to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
This is Lani. She previously accessed a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her direct-selling business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 12,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has displayed and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lani dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment. Gilda has been in this business for 12 years, and earns some additional income from farming sugarcane. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en: Socorro is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. NWTF is relisting Socorro's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Marlyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling oysters. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 54 years old and married with 7 children. She makes and sells fine mats, fans, earrings and handbags to earn a living, and has been doing this for many years. 

Lili has requested a loan to buy more pandanas, paint, paint brushes, chicken feathers, and sticky glue. She plans to use her profits to save for her business and improve her family's lives. She joined SPBD in 2001 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy more pandanas, paint, paint brushes, chicken feathers, and sticky glue

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.  Norma has been in this business for five years.  Norma earns additional income raising pigs.  Norma has been sustaining her business through her own efforts along with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian works hard to support her family.  Vivian is married and has a general store in the Philippines.  Vivian requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.  Vivian has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Vivian would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lise

texts.en: Lise is a 34 year old woman who is married with 6 children. She runs a business sewing in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Lise has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, material, thread, and needles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees and to improve her household. She joined SPBD in 2001 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, material, thread, and needles

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en:
The Jaya Usaha Baluk group borrowed a new loan in order to purchase superior quality piglets, to purchase feed, and to repair cages.  This pig business has been shown to supplement the family income.

Because Ni Nengah already has a sow, she will use the loan to buy two superior piglets for fattening and for quality pig feed.  This will help the pigs grow fast.  She plans to save money to develop their business.  Their daily needs are met by her husband who was very supportive of Ni Nengah’s efforts.  She hopes that her plan will run smoothly so that she may become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 53-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol.  She has three children ages twenty-six, twenty-two, and twenty years old, respectively.  She has been in the food vending business for fifteen years.  She sells chicken barbecue and siopao, which is the Filipino version of a steamed bun (dough filled with a savory meat and cooked by steam).  She plans to use the loan to buy additional ingredients for siopao (flour, soy sauce, ground pork) and for chicken barbecue (chicken, soy sauce, ketchup).  In the future, Sonia would like to expand her business to be successful in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients (flour, ground pork, soy sauce, ketchup).

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Estrelita is 32 years old, married and has four children who are in school.  Estrelita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  Estrelita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Estrelita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Estrelita would like to save money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ann Radhamohan Self Help Group

texts.en:
"Ann Radhamohan" is a women's self help group with 12 members. The members reside in the village of Jaripada in Odisha, India. The lady standing in the middle of the photograph with a register is Babi.  

Babi is the president of the group. Babi, 41, and her husband Surendra, 45, have two children who are currently in school. For five years, this husband and wife have worked as a team selling fresh and dried fish in the market. Surendra goes to the large Chilika Lake to fish and brings home the hard-earned products of his labor, while Babi prepares dried fish to sell in the local market.  

They hope to get a loan to purchase fishing net and a storage box to store and transport the fish.  With the ability to fish and store larger quantities of fish, they hope to increase their profit.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and a storage box to store and transport more fish to sell in the local fish market.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, 57, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her five children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosana operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Rosana’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosana hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams that her children will have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en: Ni Komang succeeded to maintain her pigs and her husband supports her business because the result can help to improve the family income. She also succeeded to renovated the barn. Now she needs a new loan to purchase superior quality feed to make the piglets grow faster and also to purchase two superior piglets for fattening. Because the loan is not enough to purchase all of it, her husband will also give her money to support the business. She hopes the piglets can grow fast and healthy so she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

loans.use: To purchase superior quality feed and two superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia, she previously accessed a 32,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. His profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucia dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance needed in her computer business

loans.name: Kashinatha

texts.en:
Kashinatha is a 43-year-old physically-challenged person living with his mother, wife and his son, age 2. He is the only earning person in his family. He does a seasonal grain and fertilizer business. Now he has a fertilizer shop in his village market which is one and half kilometers far from his home. From this fertilizer business, he is earning 5,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. As a physical-challenged person, he wants to set up a general store in this market. He wants to sell cosmetic items, soft drinks, ice cream, face creams, hair oils, shampoos, body talc, body deodorants, body lotions and fashion accessories (earrings, finger rings, bangles, bracelets, bangles, etc.)

Kashinatha has applied for a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase these products for his variety shop by taking a room in rent. He says that he can earn 5,500 to 6,000 INR per month from this business. He can look after his family. He wants to send his son to a good school and see him in a higher position in a company.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic items, soft drinks, ice cream, face creams, hair oils, shampoos, body talc, body deodorants, body lotions and fashion accessories (earrings, finger rings, bangles, bracelets, bangles, etc.) for his general store

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 32 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store. Michelle has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and married with five children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from dried coconut meat retail and raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Pacita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Pacita has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Pacita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Lenie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending &  a junk shop business. Lenie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Lenie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco de veinticinco años de edad vive actualmente con sus abuelos y sus vecinos proveen muy buenas referencias de él, es una persona muy emprendedora a quien le gusta trabajar, de muy buenos principios y que a pesar de su relativa juventud posee ya diez años de experiencia en la agricultura específicamente en la siembra de granos básicos, en una zona especialmente agrícola ubicada en laderas y planicies ideales para la siembra también posee ingresos mensuales ya que realiza trabajos de albañilería por lo tanto es un cliente con un muy buen respaldo, el cliente solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de insumos semilla de maíz y  frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. que le permitan optimizar la calidad de su cosecha y asegurar poder pagar el monto de el crédito acordado. José francisco confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Francisco, who is 25 years old, now lives with his grandparents, and his neighbors provide very good references for him. He is a very entrepreneurial person who likes to work, has very good principles, and who, in spite of his relative youth, already has 10 years of experience in agriculture, specifically in planting basic grains in an agricultural zone especially located on hillsides and flat plains ideal for planting. He also has monthly income since he does masonry work, and thus he is a [loan] client with very good backing.  He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy supplies -- seeds for corn and beans, insecticides, herbicides, etc. -- which will allow him to optimize the quality of his harvest and assure that he will be able to pay the amount of the loan agreed upon. José Francisco trusts that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn and beans, insecticides, and herbicides

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Doña Natalia tiene 68 años de edad, vive con su esposo y una nuera, ya sus hijos son independientes, reside en Taulabe, Comayagua. Ella tiene 40 años aproximadamente de generar sus propios ingresos. 
Se dedica a la confección de ropa de vestir para damas como vestidos, blusas, faldas y pantalones y a elaborar manualidades como ser: elaboración de coronas para difuntos, hace arreglos florales de todo tipo y decoraciones.  Doña Natalia ha sido cliente de ODEF por varios años, lleva catorce ciclos de préstamos, actualmente está solicitando 12,000 Lempiras para comprar materiales de confección como telas, hilos y agujas, también materiales para la elaboración de coronas y arreglos florales. Con este préstamo va cubrir la demanda que tiene de sus clientes y aumentar las ventas. 
Su meta es seguir incrementando su negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes con la mejor calidad con la que se distinguen sus productos.
texts.en:
Doña Natalia is 68 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter-in-law. Her children are independent. She resides in Taulabe, Comayagua. Natalia has been generating her own income for approximately 40 years.

She produces women’s clothing such as dresses, blouses, skirts, and trousers. In addition, she makes handicrafts such as funeral wreaths, floral arrangements, and other types of decorations. Doña Natalia has been a client of ODEF for several years and has completed 14 loan cycles. She is now requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL so that she can buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and needles. Natalia will also purchase materials for making wreaths and floral arrangements. With this loan, she will be able to satisfy the demand from her customers and increase her sales.

Natalia’s goals are to continue growing her business and to satisfy her customers by providing them with products that are of the best quality.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and materials for making funeral wreaths and floral arrangements.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Angela works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and raising pigs. Angela is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock for her dried fish business. She uses her motorcycle to sell dried fish in remote areas. This is her second loan with Kiva.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jelly Mae

texts.en:
Jelly Mae is 25 years old and married with four children.

Jelly Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Jelly Mae has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock and motorcycle transport.

Jelly Mae aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 20 years. Ma. Theresa earns more income from a motorcycle transport business.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Luisa requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a 10,000 (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients.

Maricel has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients.

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is 36 years old and a mother of three children. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for 13 years. She sells items like soft drinks, tuba (coconut wine), biscuits, sugar, coffee, vinegar and canned goods. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to purchase additional items like soft drinks like Coke and Pepsi, tuba, canned goods, shampoo and coffee. Ma.Teresa would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks, tuba (coconut wine), biscuits and coffee.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: This time, Felisa is borrowing 13,000 (Philippines pesos) to purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell. The fruit vending business that she previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva partner, continues and provides Felisa and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 62 years old and married. Adela works very hard to provide for the family.

Adela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Adela has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 51 years old and a widow with six children.

Marlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Marlene has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming coconut/selling dried coconut meat.

Marlene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melanie is 48 years old.

Melanie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a 11,000 (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José es un jornalero de treinta años de edad que vive actualmente con su compañera de vida y su hijo es una persona responsable, dedicada a su trabajo de buenas referencias no posee ningún compromiso financiero, José se dedica al cultivo agrícola de cereales y hortalizas en propiedades arrendadas de la zona que se encuentra en excelentes condiciones para el desarrollo de sus actividades agrícolas, cuenta con mas de 15 años de experiencia  trabajando de jornalero, le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para optimizar la calidad de su cosecha de sandias y ajonjolí y lograr una mejor ganancia para el sustento de su familia y la prosperidad de su trabajo, el cliente asegura poder cumplir con el pago del crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Juan José is a day laborer who is 30 years old and currently lives with his partner and son. He is a responsible person who is dedicated to his work and has good references. He does not have any other financial commitment. Jose makes a living growing grains and vegetables on rented land in an area with excellent conditions for agricultural development.

He has more than 15 years of experience working as a day laborer. He is requesting a loan from Integral to buy agricultural supplies to optimize the quality of his watermelon and sesame crops and to obtain greater earnings to sustain his family and prosper in his work. The client assures that he will be able to fulfill the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy sesame and watermelon seeds and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Mirna Aracely

texts.es: Mirna Aracely vive junto a su compañero de vida tienen una hija, Mirna es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a sus labores, se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de frijol, todo lo que comercia lo vende en los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y un excelente servicio, la cliente posee una muy buena historia de pagos  posee un crédito que ha manejado con buena calificación, y comenta que necesita un préstamo para aprovechar la siembra de frijol y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas semilla de frijol, insecticida, abono, etc. Asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda antes del plazo estipulado en el crédito que utilizara para asegurar una mejor  calidad para la vida de su familia y de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Mirna Aracely lives with her partner with whom she has a daughter. Mirna is an entrepreneurial woman dedicated to her work.  She makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing beans. She sells all of it in the surrounding areas of her community and already has many customers that prefer to buy from her because of the quality, good prices and excellent services. 

The client posesses a good payment record and has managed a loan with good qualification. She comments that she needs a loan to be able to plant beans. She is requesting the loan from Integral to buy the agricultural supplies including bean seeds, inseciticide, fertilizer, etc. She is certain that she will be able to make her payments before the deadline stipulated. She will use the loan to ensure a better qualify life for her family and for her crops.

loans.use: bean seeds, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Dolores De Jesus

texts.es: José Dolores de cuarenta y tres años de edad tiene un negocio de siembra de maicillo, pipián y maíz también posee un molino de nixtamasa como modo de subsistencia, el cliente tiene muy buenas referencias personales, es muy trabajador, humilde, responsable como también en el comportamiento de sus pagos siempre esta a tiempo con ellos no se atrasa, todo lo que produce lo comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad donde reside y ya tiene mucha clientela fija que lo prefiere por la calidad los buenos precios y sobre todo por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de las personas, en esta temporada de cosecha quiere aprovechar y realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, pipián, fertilizantes, abono, etc. José Dolores tiene buenas referencias de pago y  es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
José Dolores is 43 years old and has a business growing sorghum, squash and corn. He also owns a flour mill as another form of subsistence. The client has very good personal references. He is very hard working, humble and responsible. In regard to his payment record, he is always on time and doesn't pay late. He sells all that he produces in the surrounding areas of the community where he lives. He already has many regular clients that prefer him for the quality, good prices and above all unmatched service. He is always ready to serve others. 

In this harvest season he wants to take advantage of the opportunity to make a new investment but does not have enough capital. For this reason he is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy corn, sorghum and squash seeds and fertilizers, etc. José Dolores has good financial references and is very responsible. He is certain that he will be able to pay back his debt and at the same time is confident that he will give his family a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy corn, sorghum and squash seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: José Josué

texts.es:
José es un joven de 23 años de edad y es soltero, vive junto a sus padres y sus tres hermanos en Sololá.
Es una persona trabajadora dispuesto a seguir apoyando a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida. El se dedica al cultivo de verduras como papa, zanahoria, cebolla y frijol esto lo realiza en una parcela que tienen con su familia  a pocos kilómetros de la vivienda.
Desde hace muchas años el aprendió a trabajar en el campo de la agricultura ya que es la primera actividad que le enseño su padre. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres pudo estudiar  y terminar una carrera académica, siendo así el ayudaba a su padre medio día  en el campo y medio día era para estudiar.
Terminando su carrera académica ve que la falta de empleo en su comunidad cada vez es más bajo, de este modo desde hace 6 años decidió y empezó a cultivar verduras en varias parcelas que tiene su padre para apoyar siempre a la economía de la familia 
Por la temporada del año estas verduras son mejor cosechadas y mantienen mejores precios en el mercado local. Ahora el solicita un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa, zanahoria y fertilizantes que estará usando para expandir mas su cultivo y obtener  mejores ganancias.
Construir una casa y adquirir una parcela mas, es su mayor sueño pensando que en un futuro el estará formando su propia familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man, 23 years old, and is single. He lives with his parents and three siblings in Sololá. He is hardworking and wants to continue helping his family improve their living conditions. He grows vegetables like potatoes, carrots, onion and beans on a parcel of land that his family has a few kilometers from their home. 

Many years ago he learned to work in the field of agriculture - it is the first thing his father taught him. Thanks to the efforts of his parents he was able to go to school and finish his education. He used to help his father in the fields for half they day and study the other half. Upon finishing school he saw that unemployment in his community was decreasing all the time, and he decided 6 years ago to begin growing vegetables on various pieces of land that his father has, in order to support his family financially.

This is the best season for harvesting vegetables and getting good prices in the local market. Now he asks for a loan of 6,000 Quetzales to buy potato and carrot seeds and fertilizers that he will be using to expand his crop and get better profits. His greatest dream is to build a house and get another parcel of land, because in the future he will be forming his own family.

loans.use: to buy carrot and potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina  is 21 years old and married. She has 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so that she can sell them in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Mina needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, a weedkiller spray and more tiapula, in order to improve her family's assets. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Mina will use the profits from her sales to help her children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase a wheel barrow, weed killer, bush knives and a shovel.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Herminia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her general store business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Faafete

texts.en:
Faafete is 28 years old and married. She has 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Faafete needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, a weedkiller spray and more tiapula. 

Faafete has been a member of SPBD since 2011 and joined to gain access to financial stability. Faafete, in the future, will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, shovel, rake and weed killer.

loans.name: Danita

texts.en:
This is Danita, 51, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marlito and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Danita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Danita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise ordered by her customers

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa, 45, a resident of GMA, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Bienvenido, a carpenter. She is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Luisa oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Ma. Luisa is requesting a PHP26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Luisa dreams her business will grow to help her family and she hopes to give her children a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Jahel

texts.en:
Jahel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines.

Jahel requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

Jahel has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Jahel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family. Mercy is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mercy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Mercy has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mercy would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for materials to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelda is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nelda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nelda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

Nelda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Nelda would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 52 years old and married. She has two children.

Anabelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair) business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Anabelle has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair) business for 13 years and also earns an income from a pharmacy.

Anabelle aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ice cream making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

Melinda has been in this business for 21 years. She earns additional income from a tricycle service.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Tsengelmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsengelmaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter in a small house in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Gansuh. He is 42 yrs old. He purchases old and broken cars, repairs and then sells them for a higher price. Her daughter goes to secondary school. She worked at a private tailoring company as an assistant for 20 years. She was laid off from work in 2010. She has been unemployed since then. She is planning to start her own business manufacturing souvenirs, slippers and key chains. She has manufactured a few by order and people really liked them. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory and machinery for her souvenir production business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and machinery for her souvenir production business

loans.name: Noemie

texts.en:
Noemie is 31 years old and married with two children.

Noemie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Noemie has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Noemie aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Nonalyn

texts.en:
Nonalyn is 21 years old and single.

Nonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Nonalyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nonalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Judith is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judith has been farming vegetables for eight years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nida has been in this business for 20 years. Nida earns more income from ice cream vending and raising pigs.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Adrianus

texts.en:
Adrianus is a 52-year-old widower. His wife died about six years ago. He has four children from his marriage. Two of his children are married and live on another island and the other two children are still living with him and are attending school. To support his family, Adrianus initiated a repair shop business four years ago.
 
Adrianus was thinking about to improving his business by adding more spare parts. Therefore, he submitted a loan application to request IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on spark plugs, inner tubes, etc. Adrianus is expecting that this loan will help him improve his business and family life.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, inner tubes, etc.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending and crabs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more fish and crabs to sell for her business.Remy has been in this business for 18 years. Remy earns more income from fishing and raising pigs.

Remy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Rosalinda has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Salve works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and farming rice. Salve is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of grains to sell for her buying and selling rice grains business.

Salve has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of grains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for growing rice

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Ruqaya prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Ruqaya is a 23-year-old married woman who supports three family members from Jabal Al-Hussain, Amman, Jordan. 

Ruqaya is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy clothes to resell. She has been selling her products in the area with a group of the women, but now she wants to sell clothes on her own. She hopes in the future to expand her business by opening a shop with her husband. As a result, she hopes to be able to improve her living standard and to continue supporting her sons' education.

Since Ruqaya is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Maisoun

texts.en:
Maisoun is a 28-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Nasser Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy hay and other materials for making her handmade crafts. She would like to increase her products and her income. 

In the future, Maisoun hopes to buy a new home and car. 

Since Maisoun is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy hay and other materials.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27 year old man from Jarash, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy furniture and other household items so that he can arrange his house for his future wife before their marriage. In the future he hopes to provide a good environment to live in.  
Since Mohammad is under 30 years old his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy furniture and other household items.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Zainab prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband. Zainab is a 28-year-old married woman who has 2 family members from Jarash Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements: she would like to do maintenance and repaint her home. In the future she hopes to improve her living standard. Since Zainab is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Swzan

texts.en:
Swzan is a 19-year-old married woman from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy foodstuffs in her store. 

She hopes in the future to increase her products and her income and to buy a new home for her family.

Since Swzan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to resell.

loans.name: Asma'a

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Asma'a prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband. Asma'a is a 24-year-old married woman from Ashrafia Amman Jordan who has 1 family member. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to repaint her home and do maintenance of the home. She hopes in the future to improve her living standard. Since Asma'a is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Lana prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Lana is a 28-year-old married woman who has two family members from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She would like to increase her products to increase her income. 

Since Lana is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Narjes

texts.en:
Narjes is a 29-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for materials for her salon. She would like to buy a machine for hair and skin. She wants to develop her project and open a salon to increase her family's income.

Since Narjes is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a 23 year old married female from Al Russeifeh in Amman, Jordan. She has 2 children and has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. She is planning to buy some furniture and to pay for painting expenses. Riham had previously run a project in the nearby area and in the future she would like to expand it.

Since Riham is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Wafa'a

texts.en: Wafa'a is a 24-year-old married woman who lives with two family members in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.  She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy new furniture and do maintenance to the home.  In the past she repainted her home. In the future she hopes to expand her home.  Since Wafa'a is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
Hussam is a 22-year-old single male from Hay Nazal in Jordan.  Hussam requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for his home improvement expenses.  In the future he wants to renew the furniture and have his own business.

Since Hussam is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: pay for home improvement expenses

loans.name: Hala'a

texts.en:
Hala'a is a 25-year-old married woman from Al Koorah, Jordan. She has two children. Due to cultural reasons, Hala'a  prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet. The photo here is of her husband. 

Hala'a is requesting a 300 JOD loan to pay for home improvement expenses and buy some electronic home devices. Since she is under 30 years old, her loan is a youth loan. In the future, Hala'a would like to add another room to her home.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses and buy electronic home devices

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Amal prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Amal is a 25-year-old, married female from Baqa'a, Jordan. She has four children. She has requested a loan of 800 JOD to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. In the future, she would like to build an upper floor for her children and pay for their education.

Since Amal is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Bara'a

texts.en: Bara'a is a 21-year-old single female from Sahab in Jordan. She has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. Because Bara'a is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Hadel

texts.en:
Hadel, a 21-year-old single woman from Al Nasser, Amman Jordan, is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy materials for her salon such as coloring, a hair dryer, etc. Currently working out of her home, she would like to open a beauty salon and eventually buy a car.

Since Hadel is under 30 years old, hers is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for her salon.

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Tasneem prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Tasneem, a 25-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa in Jordan, has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for retailing in cosmetics and accessories. She would like to expand her enterprise and have her own small shop in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Tasneem is under 30 years of age, hers is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hoes and fertilizer, and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Luvy Jeaneth

texts.es: Luvy Jeaneh de 27 anos de edad, casada con un hijo de 4 anos. Luvy es originaria de la localidad del jicaral, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Luvy siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora, de buena costumbre. Ella ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación león 2000 y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos en tiempo y forma. La actividad económica de Luvy es la venta de ropa y cosméticos de forma ambulante y tiene clientela de fija y eventuales. La rutina diaria de Luvy es salir a vender a la calle 10 horas diarias para entregar la mercadería por encargo, la cual recupera la ganancia quincenalmente. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pequeño negocio y aprovecha porque se acercan la temporada con mayores venta por las promociones y temporada navideña. Con el financiamiento comprara camisas, pantalones, short, faldas, pinturas labias, perfumees, crema hidrates de cuerpo.  Luvy agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en: Luvy Jeaneh is 27 years old, married and has a 4-year-old son. She is originally from Jicaral, which is in the northern part of the country. Luvy has always been known for being a very responsible, hardworking and well-mannered woman. She has had loans with Kiva partner Fundación León 2000 and has been responsible with her payments. Luvy makes a living selling clothing and cosmetics on the streets and has a regular customer base. Her routine is to go out to sell on the street 10 hours a day and deliver her goods, and she collects her payments every other week. She is requesting the loan to stock her small business and take advantage of the time of year when sales peak around Christmastime. She plans to purchase shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, lipsticks, perfumes, and body lotions. Luvy is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to people of scant resources in countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, lipstick, perfumes, and body lotions.

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
El señor Alejo es de la comarca llamada el Zapote, Teustepe ha  trabajado por varios periodos con MiCrédito desde los grupos solidarios  obtuvo su primer crédito de Kiva el cual le ayudo ya que pudo realizar sus trabajos de siembra de maíz, frijol y trigo y pagar la mano de además compro abono y refrescante que utilizó en el cultivo del frijol. 
Está requiriendo un segundo crédito don alejo lo quiere para pagar mano de obra para dar limpieza y mantenimiento de los potreros y comprar alambre para reparar los cercos.  Al estar los potreros limpios sin monte nacerá mejor el pasto y las vacas paridas que tiene darán mas leche  para hacer las cuajadas don alejo dice que su próximo crédito seria para comprar los insumos y abono para la siembra de frijol y maíz.
texts.en: Alejo is from the Zapote, Teustepe region and has worked with MiCrédito a number of times since taking out his first Kiva loan, which helped him with farming corn, beans and wheat by allowing him to pay for labor and purchase fertilizer for his beans. He is requesting another loan to pay workers to clean and maintain his fields as well as purchase wire to fix his fences. Keeping his fields clean will improve the grass, and the young calves that he has will produce more milk to make curds. Alejo says that his next loan will be to purchase supplies and fertilizer to plant corn and beans.

loans.use: to pay workers to clean and maintain his fields and to purchase wire to fix his fences.

loans.name: Denis Isaac

texts.es: Denis Isaac de  45 anos de edad, soltero con cuatro hijos de 12, 7, 5,3 anos. Él es originario de Malpaisillo lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país, Malpaisillo se caracteriza por una zona agrícola. Denis es un hombre muy responsable, trabajador, con ganas de salir adelante en la vida por sus pequeños hijos para brindarle un futuro mejor. Él tiene por actividad económica un taller de ebanistería el cual consisten en la elaboración de mueble de madera y hierro, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en   un lugar especifico de su localidad. Experiencia en el negocio 3 anos. Negocio que surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para poder sostener a su familia y brindarle la seguridad que necesitan. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de madera  y hierro para la elaboración de muebles. Denis Isaac agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digna.
texts.en:
Denis Isaac, 45, is single and has four children, ages 12, 7, 5 and 3.  He is from Malpaisillo which is located in the northern part of the country.  Malpaisillo is known for being an agricultural region.  Denis is a very responsible, hard-working man who is determined to get ahead in life for his small children, and to give them a better future.  He has a carpentry shop, in a specific location in town, where he makes furniture out of wood and iron.  He has been in business for three years and started it to have a source of income to support the family and provide the necessary security.

He is in need of a loan for working capital and to stock his company with wood and iron to make furniture.  Denis Isaac is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have decent jobs.

loans.use: To buy wood and iron to make furniture.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has three children and has been doing this work for seven years.  Her primary income sources are eggs, crops, and personal work.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Being her own boss!" Her biggest challenge is "Sometimes during the dry season the crops don't do well and the animals too lack food." The animal on the farm is named "Lelmet".She will use the loan to buy irrigation pipes.

Viola was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Got news from a client in Kitale."  She was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Juhudi's unique loan products."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit your family, Viola replied, "From the loan she will be able to invest and thus increase her asset base."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Viola owns the following:  a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and a sewing machine but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation pipes

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. He has seven children. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal work, and he has been doing this work for 17 years.
