He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "He loves being his own boss and from farming this has been made possible!" His biggest challenge is "During dry season it is difficult to get food for the animals."  Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Miso".He will use the loan to buy a water tank.

Benjamin was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Got information from other members." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Various loan products from Juhudi; policies."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit your family, Benjamin replied, "With an additional cow his income will be greatly increased."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benjamin owns the following:  a cow, poultry, a pump, and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase water tanks for irrigation.

loans.name: Exequiel

texts.es:
Exequiel, un humilde campesino de 52 años, habitante de la comunidad El Bálsamo, Teustepe, padre de 3 hijos. Él se dedica a la siembra de maíz, trigo y frijol, lleva de 35 años trabajando en esta actividad, la cual aprendió por tradición pues sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo. Toda su producción la vende en la misma comarca, además aprovecha a sembrar más en invierno, para almacenar granos básicos durante el verano pueda enfrentar la escases de estos productos y de esta manera no dejar de vender a buen precio y tener para consumo del hogar. 
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar insumos, abonos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar frijol y maíz. Espera darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cosechas. Una vez que  cancele su crédito, invertirá en comprar 2 terneros.
texts.en:
Exequiel, 52, is a humble farmer who lives in the community of El Bálsamo in Teustepe.  He has three children.  He grows crops such as maize, wheat and beans, and has been in this activity for 35 years, as he learned the trade from his parents.  He sells all of his produce around the area where he lives; and he plants more in the winter time to be able to store basic grains during the summer in case there is a lack of product.  This way he can keep his prices low and also have enough for home consumption.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers, and to hire workers to plant beans and maize.  He hopes to be able to provide better maintenance for his crops.  As soon as he pays off the loan, he plans to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers, as well as hire workers to plant beans and maize.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has one daughter. She lives with her life partner in their own house in the community of Msambweni.

Fatuma has her own vegetable stall, selling a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables. She established her business in her home one year ago. Her customers prefer her goods because of the quality and freshness of her fruits and vegetables.

She is currently requesting her second loan cycle, which is for 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She will use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables such as bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, kale, etc.

Her goal is to increase sales, to manage to have funds saved, and to give her daughter a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables such as bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, kale, etc.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and owns a barber shop which has been in operation for almost three years; he began the business from the savings he had made for a long period of time. Apart from this, he is also employed as a teacher.

Ambrose is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of cosmetics and to purchase shavers to use in opening another shop. He was introduced to Milango by his friends. Although the business faces the challenge of competition, Ambrose believes that the addition of these new machines will help improve his sales.

His ambition is to open other barber shops and employ more staff.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cosmetics and to purchase shavers.

loans.name: Sayda Melania

texts.es: Sayda Melania de 34 anos de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de 7 anos de edad el cual asiste a la escuela primaria. Sayda es originaria del municipio del Sauce el cual esta ubicado en la zona norte de país. Sayda tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace  anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. Una pulpería es una tienda que vende productos en cantidades menores como un paquete de galleta, una caja fosforo, granos básicos en libra o ½ libra. Sayda se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora por sus hijos como madre soltera que es tiene que ver por el sustento de su familia. Adema en esto momento se le presenta el problema de salud de su mama a la cual ella asiste personalmente. Sayda ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado ser responsable en tiempo y forma. El negocio lo inicio con esfuerzo propio y lo aprendió de su mama la cual se dedicaba a dicha actividad. en la actualidad el financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diario del hogar como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, huevos, pollo, tiste, cebadas, fosforo.  Sayda agradece la ayuda que le brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sayda Melania, 34, is a single mother of a 7-year-old son who goes to elementary school.  Sayda is from the town of Sauce which is located in the northern part of the country.  She runs a grocery store out of her house and has been in business for several years.  Her store sells products in small quantities such as packs of cookies, boxes of matches, or small bags (a pound or pound and a half) of grain.  

Sayda is known for being a very hard-working woman who makes every effort, as a single mother, to provide for her family.  And, now she must deal with the problem of her mother's failing health, since she is the care giver.   Sayda has worked with the Foundation before and is very responsible paying back the loan.  She began her business through her own efforts and learned the trade from her mother who also ran a store.  

She is requesting a loan to use as work capital to stock her store with daily consumption groceries such as rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, chicken, barley and matches.  Sayda is grateful for the help being given to people with scarce resources who live in poor countries like Nicaragua, so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, chicken, barley, matches.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old, married, and has two children. To earn a living she sells second-hand clothes. She has been in the business for four years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained on business management skills.

Mary's desire is to own a boutique in the future. 

She needs a loan of 4,000 KES to buy an energy-saving cooker for personal use.

loans.use: to buy an energy-saving cooker.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 23, lives together with her friend in West Point. She stopped her education in the tenth grade and has a son that is five months old. 

She has been involved in this business for the past two years: she has a table in the market where she sells body spray, body cream, body powder, hand cream, lip stick and body wash. She learned to sell from her friend because of her good interactions with her customers; they always come in to buy. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more body spray, body cream, hand wash, body powder and lip stick for the business. She plans to give her son a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more body spray, body cream, hand wash, body powder and lip stick for the business.

loans.name: Kombo

texts.en:
Kombo is 34 years old and is happily married to one wife who is a businesswoman. They have been blessed with 4 children. He earns his living selling dry fish from his house, which he buys from the town market. He also runs a vegetable stall, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables. He would like to expand his businesses. 

Kombo is asking for a loan so that he can buy dry fish and more fruits and vegetables since they are in high demand and he would like to increase his stock.

loans.use: buy dry fish and more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 25 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has four children between the ages of 2 and 8. All of her children attend school and live at home.

For the past 10 years, Deborah has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She plans to be a successful businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married businesswoman who lives in Malindi. She is the mother of five children, all of whom are in school.  She sells coconut leaf roofing material, commonly referred to as "makuti." Makuti is preferred for roofing in the Malindi area and along the coast generally, since it insulates the house from the heat, mainly experienced during the daytime. She has been running this business for ten years. She also sells fish and keeps goats.
Dama was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase more coconut leaves, fish and goats. Her main challenges are high inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most of her customers, and a shortage of reliable customers.
Dama will save the additional income generated with this loan and use it to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy coconut leaf roofing material for resale, fish to sell and goats to raise.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel, de 27 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo de 3 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, habitante de la comarca La Joya, Teustepe . Trabaja en la agricultura desde los 12 años de edad actividad que realizaba junto con su padre. Al casarse comenzó a trabajar por sus propios medios vendiendo artículos para el hogar de manera ambulante, con esto comenzó a ahorrar para comprar un terreno para sembrar aunque esta actividad la realiza cuando no sembrando , siempre buscando la manera de conseguir mejores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Está solicitando el crédito para comprar 2 terneros para desarrollo. Pues su idea es lograr tener ganado para producción de leche y diversificar su negocio.
texts.en:
Daniel, 27, is married and the father of a 3-year-old son.  He is a farmer and lives in the county of La Joya, Teustepe.  He has been working in agriculture since he was 12 years old when he used to work with his father.  When he married he began working independently selling household products as a street vendor.  He started saving to buy land to grow crops, although he keeps active selling even when his is not planting.

He is always looking for ways to increase his income in order to give his family a better quality of life.  He is requesting a loan to buy two calves for fattening.  His idea is to have lifestock for dairy production in order to diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy two calves for fattening.

loans.name: Maria

texts.ru:
Мария торгует женской одеждой. В прошлый раз она  использовала кредит для закупки осенней одежды. В этот раз ей нужны дополнительные оборотные средства для закупки зимней одежды - пальто и курток. 

Недавно Мария с мужем купили недорогую квартиру для своего сына. За счет дополнительной прибыли Мария планирует сделать ремонт в квартире сына и купить немного мебели.
texts.en:
Maria sells women's clothing. She used her previous loan to purchase fall clothing, whereas this time she needs additional capital for the purchase of winter clothing, specifically coats and jackets. 

Maria and her husband recently bought an inexpensive apartment for their son. Maria plans to use the extra profit to renovate her son's apartment and purchase some furniture.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing - coats and jackets

loans.name: Liana

texts.ru:
Лиана торгует продуктами на рынке. Она уже пользовалась КИВА кредитом для расширения ассортимента товара. Это положительно сказалось на ее бизнесе и прибыли. Лиана смогла улучшить свои бытовые условия - сделала небольшой ремонт в доме.

В этот раз Лиана просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки сахара, крупы, чая и кофе. Она надеется привлечь больше покупателей и получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Liana sells groceries and other household products at a market. She has previously used a loan from KIVA to expand her product offering and it turned out well for her business and her profit. Liana was able to improve her living conditions by doing a small renovation in her home. 

This time Liana is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, grains, tea, and coffee. She hopes to attract more customers and increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, grains, tea, and coffee

loans.name: Sanobarhon

texts.ru:
Санабархан 55 лет,  родилась и выросла в Селе Марказ,  Баткенской области. У  Санабархан один сын. Ему 23 года. Муж Санабархан скоропостижно скончался. В течении многих лет основным источником дохода для семьи Санабархан является садоводство.  Они начали свой бизнес с 10,000 сом. Сын Санабархан помогает ей в ведении бизнеса, так как он хорошо освоил садоводство, он  вовремя удобряет и обрабатывает деревья. У заемщицы имеется 1 га земли, где находятся сады. Помимо сада в хозяйстве Санабархан  есть скотина.   Ежемесячный доход  Санабархан  составляет 5,000 сом.  
Санабархан Обратилась в «Бай Тушум и партнеры» в третий раз, все кредиты она использовала для расширения и развитие бизнеса. В этот раз она запросила 100,000 сом.  На полученные деньги она хочет закупить семена и минеральные химикаты для удобрения земли в целях увеличения площади сада. По своему характеру Санабархан  очень спокойная и ответственная женщина. Результаты  и состояние хозяйства заемщицы говорит о её трудолюбии.
texts.en:
Sanobarhon is 55 years old. She was born and raised in the village of Markaz in the Batkenski region. She has one 23-year-old son, but her husband passed away suddenly. 

Horticulture has been her family's main source of income for many years now. They began the business with only 10,000 som. Sanobarhon's son helps her run the business, as he has mastered the practice of horticulture. He fertilizes and treats the trees on time. Sanobarhon has one hectare of land where her garden is located. Near the garden, she also has cattle. Her monthly income is 5,000 som. 

Sanobarhon is turning to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for the third time. She used her previous loans to expand and develop her business. This time she is requesting 100,000 som to purchase seeds and fertilizers to manure her land, which will improve her garden plot. Sanobarhon is a very clam and responsible woman. The results from and state of her farming speak to her hardworking nature.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to manure land for garden expansion

loans.name: Ulaanhuu

texts.en:
Mr.Ulaanhuu is 24 years old and lives with his wife and two children. His wife's name is Bolortsetseg. She is 25 years old and works for a private company. His older daughter goes to kindergarten and his younger daughter stays at home.

Mr. Ulaanhuu is starting his own metal fence and doors by order business. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory and other tools to produce metal products for his business. He is a modest and diligent man. His goal is to expand his business to become a bigger producer of metal products in future. He hopes to increase his profit and save for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and other tools to produce metal products

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is 59 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines.  Precilla requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Precilla has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Precilla would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Saralyn

texts.en:
Saralyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying & selling rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Saralyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending and raising pigs. Saralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Isabelita requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.  Isabelita has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Isabelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and married with two children. With all children in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Nancy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, biscuits, rice and other groceries.  In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia works hard to support four children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Remia requested a PHP 1650 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.  Remia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines.

Maria Elena has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Maria Elena has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Maria Elena would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children as well as for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Myra would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Myra dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education. She hopes to have a good life through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, una humilde y sencilla campesina, de 41 años, quien habita en la comarca Jazmín, Teustepe, se dedica la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella y el mayor es independiente. Termino de criar a sus hijos sola, sembrando maíz y frijol, aunque en menor grado vende ganado pues no tiene muchos animales. Con la idea de seguir creciendo puso una sencilla pulpería pues en el lugar donde habita no hay mucha y son de mucha necesidad. 
Ella está solicitando el crédito para invertir en compra de abono, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra y también para surtir de productos tales como azúcar, aceite, arroz y productos de limpieza para su pulpería.  Dentro de sus planes está la posibilidad  de comprar ganado para vender leche.
texts.en:
Luz is a humble and simple faemer. She is 41 years old and lives in the community of Jazmín, Teustepe. She farms and has 4 children, 3 of whom live with her. The oldest is on his own. She finished raising her children alone, growing corn and beans. To a lesser extent, she sells cattle, but she doesn't have many animals. With the idea of continuing to grow, she opened a simple store where she lives. There aren't many stores there and there is a lot of demand. 

She is asking for the loan to invest in buying fertilizer, manure and to pay for labor. She will also stock her store with products such as sugar, oil, rice, and cleaning products. Among her plans is the possiblity of buying cattle to sell milk.

loans.use: to invest in buying fertilizer, manure, and to pay for labor. Also, to stock up on products such as sugar, oil, rice and cleaning products for her store.

loans.name: Kimya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyakimwa, membre de l’association de crédit « Kimya », est un entrepreneur très courageuse, âgée de 39 ans, mère de 4 jeunes enfants qui étudient tous. Son mari est infirmier soignant dans un hôpital de la place. Elle est vendeuse des poissons. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché central de Virunga. Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu de son conjoint. Plus tard, elle bénéficia un fond additionnel de crédit de base de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 17 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles en profitant du programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. L’insécurité dans l’intérieur de la province constitue une menace pour le développement de ses activités. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec les poissons (24 colis) et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans l’investissement. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, finir leurs études et construire une maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées de pauvres femmes pour leur émancipation économique et financière.
texts.en: The client Kyakimwa, a member of the credit association “Kimya,” is a very courageous entrepreneur, 39 years old, and the mother of four children who attend school.  Her husband is a nurse who cares for people in a hospital in their area.  She sells fish.  She sets up her products in the central market of Virunga.  She started her business with her own funds that she received from her husband. After that, she received some additional funds through l’IMF Hekima.  She has been doing this type of income generating work for 17 years.   Even so, she has completed and benefitted from five loan cycles through l’IMF Hekima.  The insecurity within the province threatens the development of her business. This new loan will allow her to stock up on her merchandise of fish (24 cases) and the rest of the money will be reinvested in her business.  In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up, finish their studies, and to build a house.  The client would like to thank Hekima for its actions dedicated to poor women for their economic and financial liberation.

loans.use: to buy 24 cases of fish, etc.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbayar is 29 years old and lives with his two daughters and his wife in a ger in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. His wife helps him with his shoe-repair business. His older daughter entered primary school this year and his younger daughter goes to kindergarten. 

Mr. Uuganbayar is planning to open his own boot-making business. He has been learning from his mother how to produce traditional Mongolian boots since 2002. He has years of experience in both shoe repair and production. 

Mr. Uuganbayar needs 500,000 MNT to purchase raw materials and a sewing machine for his boot-making business. He is a hardworking and neat man.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and a sewing machine for his boot-making business.

loans.name: Jesmir

texts.en:
This is Jesmir, age 24, who is a resident of Batasan in the Philippines. As a single man, he lives with his parents and helps in managing their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.
  
Jesmir oversees operations of a motorcycle rental business. He has one motorcycle that he rents since the need for public transportation is increasing. He provides his services within the city. He earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, Jesmir is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Jesmir hopes to add more motorcycle units through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support her children. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Irene has requested a PHP 1650 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp for her business.

She is purchasing the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours, even after nightfall.

Irene is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila works hard to support her family; she is married, and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Laila has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Laila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean works hard to support her family. Mary Jean is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Mary Jean requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment and materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment and materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport. She has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 65 years old, married, and has nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Angeles has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Angeles requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Angeles has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Angeles would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Bayarbaatar

texts.en:
Bayarbaatar, 33, is a married man who works at the State Emergency Organization with his spouse. His family lives with his mother in her small apartment in the local district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

He needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials to renovate his mother's old apartment. If he does the construction work, his mother will be very happy with him. He wants to create better, more comfortable, living conditions for his very old mother.

loans.use: to renovate his mother's old apartment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 52, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Decoroso and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Maria operates a buying and selling business. What she basically does is buy clothes and shoes from wholesalers, then sells them with a little profit. Her products are t-shirts for men and women, shorts, shoes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of supplies and products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en: Fofoga is 51 years old and married. She has four children. She runs a small business selling sandwiches, soft drinks, snacks, etc., in her community and has been doing this for many years. Fofoga has requested a loan to buy  more supplies, such as a cooler, soft drinks, and other products she needs. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fofoga will save her profits to improve her household conditions and to pay for her children's education

loans.use: to buy a cooler, soft drinks, snacks, sandwiches, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analiza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Analiza has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Seirosa

texts.en:
Seirosa is 65 years old, a widow with two children. 
She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Seirosa  needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as chemicals, weed spray, a chainsaw and barbed wire. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Seirosa  will use the profits from her sales to maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed spray, a chainsaw and barbed wire for her taro business.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is a 52-year-old married man from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

He has been engaged in a tricycle transport business for more than ten years now. He earns an income through transporting passengers from one place to another.

Bienvinido is asking for a loan to buy  fuel and to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle and to pay the school fees of his children.

Bienvinido is hopeful that he can make his business successful. Furthermore, he wants to continually send his children to school for better learning and for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy fuel, pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle, and to pay the school fees of his children.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 15 years; she earns additional income through raising pigs.

Cecilia has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is a 50-year-old woman who is married and has six children. 

She has a small business, a cattle farm.  

Silia needs a loan to buy more cattle, barbed wire, nails and a chain saw.  

Silia joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services. She will use her profits to maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle, barbed wire, nails, and a chain saw.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 29 years. Rebecca earns more income from raising pigs.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Folole

texts.en:
Folole is 28 years old and married. She has four children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as flour, yeast, baking powder, more frying pans, etc. 

In the future, Folole hopes to maintain and improve her house and her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sacks flour, yeast, baking powder, and frying pans.

loans.name: Ayurzana

texts.en:
Ayurzana is a 28-year-old woman who lives with her parents and her three younger brothers in a little house in the Sukhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar city. 

Her father operates small business of car repair and her mother is a teacher. Her younger brothers are college students. 

Ayurzana started her grocery store business in 2009. Her shop is the only one around 800 meters. 

She is requesting a 5,500,000 MNT loan to redesign and insulate her house before the harsh Mongolian winter comes. Ayurzana is a very hardworking and diligent person who says, "I will expand my business in near future."

loans.use: To redesign and insulate her house before the harsh Mongolian winter comes.

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara is 41 years old and married with 10 children.

Sahara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Sahara has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice and coconut and from selling spare parts.

Sahara aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. Clarita has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells-crafting business.

Clarita  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shells-crafting business.

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
This is Angeli. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and pay her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Angeli hopes her business grows so she can add another branch. She also hopes to give her child a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Crysten

texts.en:
Crysten is 30 years old and married. She has one child.

Crysten works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari or general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Crysten has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Crysten aspires to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is a married man and a father of three children from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

He has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. This is the source of his income.

Billy is in need of additional capital for his business. He is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. 

Billy dreams of expanding his hog-raising venture in the future and making it more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 54 years old, married, with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Eda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 11 years; she also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 46 years old, married, with 4 children who are in school.

Lina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase merchandise to sell.

Lina has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a retail banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas. Nelinda is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell for her retail banana business.

Nelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a house-rentals business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the upkeep for her house-rentals business.

NWTF is relisting Delilah's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the upkeep of her house rentals.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconut. Vivian is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a carpenter. Carolina works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

She has been engaged in a rice-farming business for more than 20 years now. Carolina hopes to expand her business but lacks the financial means to do so. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice that she is growing and to rent farming tools. Through this loan, she will be able to grow and produce a healthy crop, thus increasing her yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice and to rent farming tools.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 59 years old and has one child who is in school.

Teresita has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 41 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Sofia is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Sofia has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sofia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a 54-year-old married woman who has run a videoke (video karaoke) machine business for more than two years now. Lolita is asking for a loan to buy another set of machines for the expansion of her business. Through a loan, she can finally make her dreams of improving her business possible.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her videoke machine.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Rosie has been in this business for 15 years. Rosie earns more income from seaweed culturing.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosana works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines. Rosana is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in their community.

NWTF is presenting Naomi's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in their community.

loans.name: Mizionmahu Group

texts.fr: MIZIONMAHU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Agossi Damienne Adodo (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Jacques. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Agossi Damienne Adodo et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Agossi Damienne Adodo a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Agossi Damienne Adodo mène comme activité la vente de divers articles et des bois de chauffage à son domicile. Agossi Damienne Adodo exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Agossi Damienne Adodo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Agossi Damienne Adodo sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MIZIONMAHU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: MIZIONMAHU is a group of three people who all live in the same neighbourhood and are friends. The group representative, Agossi Damienne Adodo (who is raising her hand in the picture), is 36 and married to a man named Jacques. The couple has three children, some of whom are in school, one of whom is under their care. Agossi Damienne Adodo and her husband live together with their child and both work together to take care of the family. Agossi Damienne Adodo only went to school for a little while. For nearly ten years now, she has sold various articles and firewood from her home. She is passionate about her work, as it allows her to provide for her own needs and for those of her child. She buys her items from a market in Bénin. In order to provide better customer satisfaction, she and her fellow Mizionmahu group members are requesting a loan. This loan will allow them to better respond to their customers' demand and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy various items and firewood.

loans.name: Christitin Group

texts.fr: CHRISTITIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Célestine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à Albert, un ferrailleur. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés. Célestine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une vingtaine d’année que Célestine mène comme activité la vente des fruits (ananas, oranges, et bananes) dans son quartier. Célestine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Célestine s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe CHRISTITIN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
CHRISTITIN is a group of three friends who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Célestine, raising her hand in the photo. Célestine is 32 years old and she is married to a scrap metal dealer named Albert. They have four children, some of whom go to school. The couple live with their children, and they handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Célestine never went to school. She started to sell fruits (pineapple, oranges and bananas) in her district about 20 years ago. She buys her merchandise in various regions of Benin. She has a passion for her work, which helps her to support herself and her children. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, Célestine is seeking a first loan together with the other members of CHRISTITIN. This credit will allow them to better meet customer demand and to bolster their profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits (pineapple, oranges and bananas) for resale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 52 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalina has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a 53-year-old widow. She is living with her grandchild, Faradila, 11 years old, who is attending the 6th grade of elementary school. Siti is blessed with 7 children. Since her husband passed away, Siti has had to struggle to cover her children’s expenditures until they are all married and live in their own house. To make a living, Siti commenced a business of selling used clothing. It has enabled her to cover all the needs of her family. 

Currently, Siti dreams of enlarging her business. She would like to sell other things, i.e., sheets and bed covers of any sizes and color. Siti believes that by providing more variety of goods she could produce more income in return. Therefore she is requesting loan assistance from TLM of IDR 4,500,000. She wants to spend the loan on bed sheets and bed covers in bulk.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and bed covers in bulk.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her general store business.

Riza has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from cooked food vending.

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy wood and new equipment for her furniture-making business.

NWTF is relisting Juanita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and new equipment to make furniture.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase necessary products and hair treatment equipment. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy hair products and hair treatment equipment needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and cover educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for hair products and hair treatment equipment needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn Ivonne

texts.es:
Evelyn es una joven de 21 años de edad, es madre soltera y saca adelante a su hijo de 5 años de edad sola ya que el padre de su pequeño la abandono y desde ese momento se convirtió en madre y padre para el. Evelyn ha afrontado muchos problemas desde muy pequeña, pero siempre ha tenido mucha fe en ella y sobre todo en Dios. Desde  muy joven aprendió a trabajar ya que en su hogar tenia muchos problemas y decidió en luchar y poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de librería, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va  bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre ofrece productos de calidad a un buen precio.

Evelyn esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como cuadernos, hojas bond al por mayor, lapiceros, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener mejores ingresos y podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y así seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle a su hijo una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 21, is a young, single mother who supports her five-year-old son alone since her son’s father abandoned them and from that moment forward she became both mother and father for him.  Evelyn has faced many problems since she was little but she’s always had much faith in herself and above all in God.  Since she was very young she learned how to work because she had many problems at home and she decided to strive and gradually with much effort managed to start a bookstore.  She spends about 8 hours daily at work and can see up to 15 customers daily.  She believes she does well in her store because she’s very kind to customers and always offers quality products at good prices.

Evelyn is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise like notebooks, bond paper at wholesale and pencils, among others in order to earn higher income and have a wider variety of goods in stock to continue striving daily to make her greatest dream reality: to give her son a good education and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Matahari Terbit Group

texts.en:
Ida, 34 years old, is married to Missin and blessed with two children: Ridwan, 11 years old and Aulia, 4 years old. Ida has been running her business for three years. She  started with selling cold drinks. With each passing day immigrants and residents have increased rapidly, so Ida's business is growing also.  She tried to expand her business to prepare not only cold drinks but fix up her kiosk to be a coffee shop and she added more snacks. 

Now, a few meters from her home, the government is going to build housing for residents in her district, and usually the workmen take breakfast and coffee time in her coffee shop. So Ida is using this loan to buy more cigarettes, coffee powder, sugar and snacks to prepare drinks in bigger amounts. 

From the profit Ida can prepare a better life for her children, for example, buying lesson books and taking her family to a local amusement park. Her dream is to send her child to college at Indonesia University.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee powder, snacks and sugar

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 63 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Roberta is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roberta has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock and from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucisia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lucisia works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Lucisia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy hardwoods and materials needed for her furniture-making business.

Lucisia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy hardwoods and materials needed for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall. 

NWTF is relisting Iluminada's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Gemma is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

NWTF is relisting Emelita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Nilda has been buying and selling livestock for four years and earns additional income from pig fattening and running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sel.l

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 46 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Julieta requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional footware to sell.

Julieta has been in business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional footware to sell.

loans.name: Rendi

texts.en:
Rendi is a 22-year-old single man who is living with his uncle. He has been involved in the brick production business for five years. He initiated the business by the capital support provided by his uncle. 

As Rendi is a hard worker, he can maintain the business until now. Within a week, Rendi is able to produce hundreds of brick to be sold. At the moment, Rendi produces the brick manually, but the increase in brick demand from his customer led him to buy a brick machine that can help him to work more quickly and efficiently. He then requested a loan from TLM amounting to 10,000,000 IDR (Indonesia rupiahs). It enables him to buy a brick machine.

loans.use: to buy a brick machine.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Hermenia requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Hermenia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Hermenia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married with seven children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, soap and other groceries.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia Yoana

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo de 5 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de un familiar, Lucia trabaja brindando atención al público en una vidriería de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y le gusta su labor.
Lucia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que actualmente esta es de madera y en la época de verano en su ciudad llueve mucho y necesita hacer refacción a su techo y otros pequeños arreglos en su vivienda; de esta manera Lucia tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones, adecuadas y seguras, que brinden mayor bienestar para ella y su familia, así pues Lucia seguirá trabando y esforzándose para lograr sus sueños de ser una buena profesional y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Lucia, 21, lives in the city of Ica with her five-year-old little boy who she loves and is her main reason for living.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the need to work to cover her expenses, she could not study a professional career but she would have liked to do so. In her free time she enjoys continuing to work and on occasion cooks a very delicious Chinese-style fried rice to share with her family.

With much effort and dedication and thanks to help from a family member, Lucia works providing customer service at a glaziers shop in town.  She starts work very early in the morning every day and can work about 8 hours.  She believes she does well because she’s very responsible and she likes her work.

Lucia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to do some home improvements because it’s currently wood and during the summer it rains a lot and she needs to repair the roof and do some other small repairs at home.  In this way, Lucia will have a house in better, more adequate, safer condition that will provide greater wellbeing for her and her family and Lucia will continue working and striving towards making her dream of becoming a good professional a reality and to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 37 years old and lives with her husband and son in house in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband Tungalagtuya is 38 years old and helps her business. Her adopted son Amarbayan is 6 months old. She is a hardworking and honest person.

Altantuya started her business in 2000 by selling organic salt retail at the local market. She extracted organic salt from the Nariin river of Hovd province. She produced iodized salt out of organically extracted salt from river. During the winter, the river freezes, and extracting salt is impossible. 

She has years of experience, declaring that "I am one of three big salt retailers within the province." She needs a loan of MNT 6,000,000 to pay transportation and production costs of organic iodized salt.

loans.use: To cover transportation and production costs of organic iodized salt.

loans.name: Eveshell

texts.en:
Eveshell works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Eveshell requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Eveshell is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house rentals. Emilia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 60 years old and married with five children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells firewood in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell.

Anita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her firewood business for 10 years and also earns income from a restaurant.

Anita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is a very hard working entrepreneur. Medilyn is 32 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Medilyn has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to buy material for her shop.

Medilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Medilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy material for her tailoring shop business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila works hard to support her family. Cirila is married and has a lumber retail business in the Philippines.

Cirila requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Cirila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Ifeoluwa Group

texts.fr: IFEOLUWA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies pratiquant la même réligion. La représentante du groupe, Houéfa Béatrice dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Houéfa Béatrice est une veuve. Houéfa Béatrice vit seule et assure seule, ses différents besoins. Houéfa Béatrice n’a pas fréquenté. Il y a près de trente ans que Houéfa Béatrice mène comme activité la vente des glacières et des lubrifiants par le système de distribution. Houéfa Béatrice exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Houéfa Béatrice s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Houéfa Béatrice sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe IFEOLUWA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
IFEOLUWA is a group of three friends who practice the same religion. The group’s representative is Houéfa Béatrice, raising her hand in the photo. Houéfa Béatrice is 37 years old and a widow. She lives alone and supports herself. She never attended school.  

She started to sell coolers and lubricants through the distribution system nearly 30 years ago. She buys her merchandise in a city of Benin. She has a passion for her work, which allows her to support herself. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, Houéfa Béatrice is seeking a first loan together with the other members of IFEOLUWA. This credit will allow them to better meet customer demand and to bolster their profits.

loans.use: to buy coolers and lubricants for resale.

loans.name: Nildenia

texts.en:
Nildenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (fiber from abaca palm leaf, used for handicraft production) weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business. Nildenia has been in this business for nine years. Nildenia earns more income from selling coconuts.

Nildenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is a 53-year-old married man and the father of seven children from Talibon, Bohol.

Dionesio is a fisherman and supports his family through it. He needs additional capital for the sustenance of his business. He is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, rope and lead weights for fishing.

Dionesio dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, rope and lead weights for fishing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has an abaca (the fiber from abaca palm leaf, used for handicraft production) weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Evelyn is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Aiwiwe Jesuton Group

texts.fr: AIWIWE JESUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Gisèle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Casimir, un menuisier. Gisèle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Gisèle vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Il y a sept années que Gisèle mène comme activité la vente de divers articles et des fagots de chauffage à son domicile. Gisèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Gisèle mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Gisèle sollicite un sixième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AIWIWE JESUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: AIWIWE JESUTON is a group of three people, all of whom live in the same neighbourhood in Bénin. The group representative, Gisèle (who is raising her hand in the photo),  is 39 and married to a man named Casimir, a carpenter. Gisèle never went to school. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are in school and live with them. She and her husband are jointly responsible for the household. For seven years, Gisèle has sold various items and bundles of firewood from her home. She gets her products from a market in Bénin. Gisèle does this work in order to be able to provide for her family's needs. In order to provide better customer service, Gisèle is requesting a sixth loan, along with her fellow AIWIWE JESUTON group members. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand, and to make more profits. Their previous loans were well paid off.

loans.use: to buy various items and bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a abaca (banana plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines and earns additional income from hog raising. Josefina is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her abaca business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel works hard to support her family. Madel is single and has a decoration sales business in the Philippines.

Madel requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more decorations to sell.

Madel has been in this business for three years now, and earns additional income from hog raising.

In the future, Madel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more decorations to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 42 years old and married with four children.

Regina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Regina has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Regina aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hilaire

texts.fr: Hilaire est un jeune camerounais âgé de 30ans, marié et sans enfant.Comme activité  Il a une quincaillerie ambulante depuis deux ans environ dans un quartier de la ville. Il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des clés mécaniques, des ampoules, les serrures, les verrous et câbles électriques afin de renforcer son stock de marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui va grandissante.Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il a pour ambition d'ouvrir une quincaillerie stable afin de commencer la vente ciment qui est un produit d'appel pour l'activité de quincaillerie.
texts.en: Hilaire is a young man from Cameroon, age 30. He is married and has no children. He has had a mobile hardware store for about two years now in his village. With this loan, he would like to buy some mechanical keys, lightbulbs, locks, bolts, and electrical cables in order to increase his stock and better serve his increasing customer base. His income allows  him to provide for his family's needs. His ambition is to open a hardware store in a stable location in order to start selling cement, which is a product in high demand for hardware stores.

loans.use: to buy some mechanical keys, lightbulbs, locks, bolts, and electrical cables.

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en: Tuul is 48 years old and lives with her son in ger (Mongolian yurt) district of Sainshand province, Mongolia. Her son is a first-year college student. Tuul started her hairdressing business in early 2000. She has 12 years experience hairdressing and has a professional degree. Her daily income is 30.000 MNT. Her business is improving and her market demand is increasing rapidly. Therefore, she needs more equipment, additional chairs and materials. She is a hardworking and honest woman who says "I need to pay my son's tuition fee and save before hand for next year's tuition also." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to pay her son's tuition fee and other expenses related to school.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee and other expense related to school.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Janet is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

NWTF is relisting Jennifer's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.
