loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mahudjro 5 Group

texts.fr: MAHUDJRO 5 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres sont des amies pratiquant dans la même réligion. La représentante du groupe, Dohoué Alice (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 50 ans et est une veuve. Dohoué Alice a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Dohoué Alice n’a pas été à l’école. Dohoué Alice vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs divers besoins. Pour ce faire, Dohoué Alice prépare et vend depuis une dizaine d’année, de la bouillie accompagné du pâté à un carrefour de sa région. Dohoué Alice exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dohoué Alice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Dohoué Alice sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDRO 5. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHUDJRO 5 is a group of five people who are all friends and practice the same religion. The group representative, Dohoué Alice (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 50 and a widow. She has four children, some of whom are in school, all of whom are under her care. She never went to school. Dohoué Alice lives alone with her children and takes care of them by herself. In order to do so, she has prepared and sold gruel with pastries at a local intersection for about ten years now. She is passionate about her work, because it allows her to provide for her children's needs and for her own.
Dohoué Alice gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. In order to provide better customer satisfaction, she is requesting her first loan along with her fellow MAHUDRO 5 group members. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 47 years old and married. He supports a family of six children. He runs a timber yard as well as offering transport service for his clients. He has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He is requesting his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which will enable him to repair and service his pickup truck.

He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his business and reinvest. His future dream is to improve his family's living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to repair his pickup.

loans.name: Sainte Therese Group

texts.fr: SAINTE THERESE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Odile Léocadie Yvette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Odile Léocadie Yvette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Odile Léocadie Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Odile Léocadie Yvette vend des nattes et des amuses gueules. Odile Léocadie Yvette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Odile Léocadie Yvette s’approvisionne dans des villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Odile Léocadie Yvette sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTE THERESE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: SAINTE THERESE is a group of three people who live in the same home. The group representative, Odile Léocadie Yvette (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 52 and married to a man named Pierre. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Odile Léocadie Yvette and her husband live together with their children and work together to shoulder the household responsibilities. Odile Léocadie Yvette never went to school. For almost fifteen years now she has sold mats and candies. She is passionate about her work because it allows her to provide for her children's needs and for her own. She gets her supplies in the villages of Bénin. In order to provide better customer service, she and her fellow group members are requesting their first loan. It will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, wheat flour and sugar for making candy.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Estrella works hard to support her family.

She has a variety store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Estrella is borrowing PHP 49,500 through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store.

Estrella has sustained her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her obtain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Clarita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future, Clarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda works hard to support her family; she is married, and has a videoke (entertainment) rentals business in the Philippines.

Rolanda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit of videoke.

Rolanda has been in this business for two years; she earns additional income from raising livestock.

In the future, Rolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional unit of videoke (entertainment machine) to rent out.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is a hardworking entrepreneur; she has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fruits to sell at her fruit-vending business.

Arcelie has been in this business for 10 years; she earns additional income from meat-vending and raising pigs.

Arcelie has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
A widow, and the parent of 3 children, Clara works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Clara is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Clara has sustained her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola is forty-four-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been in the weaving business for twenty years; she sells native baskets. She earns 6,000 a month with the weaving business.

She has requested a loan of 8,000 to buy materials for weaving like bamboo, plastic rattan, and varnish. 

In the future,Teodola would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, plastic rattan, and varnish for her basketweaving business.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Celsa has a food production business in the Philippines. Celsa requested a 16,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

Celsa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Celsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food products business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, She previously accessed an 11,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carmelita hopes to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Umushinge Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice fait partie du groupe  Umushinge et  habite à Bujumbura rural. Elle a 20 ans et mariée à Janvier un agriculteur. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant âgé de 1 an. 

Elle fait le commerce de  chaussures  depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus.

 Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait importer les habits de l’étranger, et voir son enfant étudier.
texts.en:
Béatrice is a member of the group Umushinge and she lives in rural Bujumbura. She is 20 years old and married to a farmer named Janvier. They have a 1-year-old child.  

Beatrice has been selling shoes for four years. This is her second loan cycle with Turame. She will use the credit to bolster her working capital and stock up on shoes to increase her sales and revenue. 

In the coming years, she wants to import apparel from other countries. She also plans to support her child’s education.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and stock up on shoes to increase her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Corosa

texts.en:
Corosa is 50 years old and married with six children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Corosa is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy piglets and feed. 

Corosa has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from her general store. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita is 52 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Tomasita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Tomasita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Tomasita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can rent a space in a public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shuttering material for shuttering supply business

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

Bernarda requested a 16,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving. 

She has been in this business for twenty-five years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Bernarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Eleonida

texts.en:
Eleonida is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of four young children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been running a sari-sari or convenience store for several years now. She sells various goods to the people in their locality.

Eleonida is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as rice, noodles, soda, biscuits, and candies. 

She hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more income necessary for their expenses and for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as rice, noodles, soda, biscuits, and candies.

loans.name: Kalyl

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Kalyl works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Kalyl is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items to sell at her store.

Kalyl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 53 years old and married with seven children. Two of her children are in school.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items like soft drinks, bread, candies, and other miscellaneous items.

Anecita has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Anecita aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items like soft drinks, bread, candies, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

Fe has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Marigrace

texts.en:
This is Marigrace.  She previously received a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marigrace hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
This time, for her fifth loan cycle, Edeliza is borrowing Php 12,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers.  

The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide additional capital for building and expanding her business operations.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elisa Jessica

texts.en:
Elisa Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a variety store. Elisa Jessica is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase computer supplies for her Internet cafe business.

Elisa Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell in her store.

NWTF is relisting Almira's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more cosmetics products to sell. NWTF is relisting Helen's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Annalou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Annalou has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending. Annalou aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn is 27 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenalyn has a kitchenware retail business in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase kitchenware to sell. Jenalyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a married woman and a mother of three children, ages 18, 11 and 7. They live in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Elisa has been engaged in a business making pots for several years now. This is the source of her income. Elisa dreams of improving her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Elisa is asking for a loan to buy more materials for making pots, such as clay and others. Elisa wants to augment her income and experience fullness of life with her family. Moreover, she wants to continually support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as clay, for making pots

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel  is married and has one child. Marivel is 41 years old and lives in Senote, Oroquieta City.
Marivel engages in the buying & selling of coconuts to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000  to purchase more coconuts for her buy and sell business.

Marivel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Marivel hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 32 years old and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as milk, coffee, sugar, soap, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Floresca Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento BARRIO LINDO FLORESCA está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas  mujeres,    la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Viviana tiene 46 años, tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica al servicio de peinados y de manicurista y también maquillaje en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, también tiene su vivero donde siembra variedad de hortalizas que lo comercializa en el mercado de la localidad  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Viviana va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de productos de peluquería y belleza, como tintes de cabello y ruleros, también variedad de cremas y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su salón de belleza, la Sra. Viviana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Barrio Lindo Floresca" has 8 member who are all women.  The president of the bank is Viviana, 46, who has 2 children and has a business styling hair, manicuring nails, and doing makeup in her beauty salon.  Her salon is located in the town of El Torno in the city of Santa Cruz.  She also has a nursery where she cultivates a variety of vegetables that she sells in the town market.  This is her 3rd loan with the institution. 

Viviana will use this loan to buy more hairstyling and beauty products, such as hair dyes, curlers, and a variety of creams.  

Viviana will use the profits from this business to continue buying supplies and improving her beauty salon.  Viviana is a hardworking person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes and curlers, and also a variety of creams

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Diana requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of an emergency.

Diana is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks and hazards to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is from Tianeti district. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband, two grown sons and daughter-in-law. Leila is a nurse at the local dispensary and gets a monthly salary. Her sons work for a private company to earn monthly income. Leila’s daughter-in-law is a student. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 calves and 4 milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. Leila sells them in the capital city as well in their local village.  Leila works hard, to save money and improve the living conditions for the family.

She requested a loan to purchase calves. Leila will raise them and after several months she will sell them at a good price. This will increase the family income. With the increased income, the family will expand their agricultural activities and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves, raise and sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa works hard to support one child. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Luisa requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her child with bright light when they study at night.

Luisa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks for her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shells crafting business in the Philippines.

Anita requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business.

Anita has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

NWTF is presenting Beatriz's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, stationery, and other miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish for resale at her dried fish business.

Josephine has been in this business for 11 years. Josephine earns additional income from fish vending.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Sinfrosa

texts.en:
Sinfrosa is 75 years old, married and has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sinfrosa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sinfrosa has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 36 years old, married and has one child who is in school.  Albina works very hard to provide for her family.

Albina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Albina has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, shampoo, noodles, etc. 

In the future Albina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zagdaa

texts.en: Mr. Zagdaa is 54 years old, and lives with his wife and son in the Khovd province of Mongolia. His wife helps him with the business and his son goes to secondary school. He has been running a retail food business since 2000. He started planting organic wheat and other grains this year and he also started producing flour out of the wheat he is harvesting. His attitude is good. He is requesting 5,000,000 MNT to buy wheat seeds and other grain seeds.

loans.use: To buy wheat and other grain seeds.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old, married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Marilou has a food production business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She is from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in the hog raising business, which she has been doing for almost five years. 

Evangeline is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds, food supplements, and medicines for her pigs. Through this loan, she will be able to raise healthy pigs. In the future, Evangeline hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, food supplements, and medicines for pigs.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 38 years old, married, and has one child. Amie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Amie is requesting her third loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.  Amie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Editha is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her dry goods business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell for her dry goods business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable stall business in the Philippines.

Narcisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and children.  She has a fish selling business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. She works hard to support her family. 

Elvira is requesting a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish to sell.  In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.fr: Janet est une camerounaise mariée, âgée de 27 ans et a 04 enfants dont 01 va à l'école. Comme activité, elle possède une petite alimentation qui existe depuis 04 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter le riz, le haricot, la farine, le sucre et éventuellement l'huile raffiné afin d'accroître son stock de marchandises. Elle voudrait utiliser son bénéfice pour faire la vente en semi-gros à court terme et soutenir son époux pour l'éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Janet is from Cameroon. She is married and has four children - one of whom goes to school. To make a living, she has been running a grocery shop for four years in a neighborhood in the city. With this loan, she would like to buy rice, beans, flour, sugar, and possibly refined oil in order to increase her inventory. She would like to use the profits to sell at semi-wholesale in the short term and to support her husband in their children's education.

loans.use: buy groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from San Jose,Talibon, Bohol.  Her husband is a farmer. Jocelyn helps her husband in tilling their land to grow rice. They also provide organic spray for the mango trees on their property.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay for the rent for the equipment used on the farm. She hopes to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 59 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She sells charcoal in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Eva is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 55 years old, married and has four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Fely is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fely has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Jovy has been in this business for 23 years. Jovy also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Jovy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Louise Christelle

texts.fr: Louise est une jeune femme qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Elle gère un atélier de couture depuis 6 ans. Grâce à sa bravoure elle s'est faite uene grande clientèle dont elle aimerait continuer d'assuer la satisfaction. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt pour acquérir une machine industrielle. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permetront d'augmenter son capital et d'assurer la pérennité de son activité.
texts.en: Louise is a young woman who lives in a district in the capital. She has been running a tailoring workshop for six years. Thanks to her bravery, she has earned a large customer base, which she would like to keep satisfied. To do so, she is requesting a loan to acquire a machine. The profits derived from this loan will enable her to increase her capital and to ensure that her business is sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna  est âgée  de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 3  enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec sa son mari, ses enfants et d’autres ménages   au quartier Missira de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des arisons sociales, elle commença très tôt seule à faire le commerce d’articles divers céréales, poisson, condiments alimentaires etc. Nantie de plus de 20 années  d’expériences, elle jouit d’une grande renommée et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à sa maîtrise du rouage du secteur et surtout à son sens élevé des affaires. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa demande clientèle en nette croissance, elle  décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est en relation depuis 12 mois. Elle a déjà obtenu un prêt individuel qui fut correctement remboursé. Elle  est à son 2ème prêt individuel qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter,  une tonne de riz,  elle  s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou.  
Madame Maïmouna   vend en détail,   au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.  Avec ce prêt elle   envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 90 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra d’aider son mari à prendre en charge les dépenses familiales (achat de savons, médicaments, frais de scolarités des enfants).
texts.en:
Madame Maïmouna is 46, married, and has three children. She has a traditional family and lives with her husband, children, and other households in the Missira neighbourhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).
Having not attended school for social reasons, she started selling various grains, condiments, and fish on her own at a young age. With over 20 years of experience, she enjoys great fame and renown. Her high sales are due to her mastery of the inner workings of the business and to her good business sense.
In order to provide customer satisfaction efficiently, she has decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. She has had a relationship with the organization for 12 months now. She has already received one individual loan which was properly repaid. This is her second individual loan, and she will use it to buy one tonne of rice. She gets her supplies in Ségou.  
Madame Maïmouna sells at retail prices, cash and credit, to a clientele made up mainly of women. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 90 000 FCFA. This will allow her to help her husband with the household costs (buying soap, medicines, paying school tuition for the children).

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Midonougbo Group

texts.fr: MIDONOUGBO est un groupement de onze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier  et appartiennent à une même colectivité. La représentante du groupe, Victoire dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 50 ans. Victoire est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Victoire a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de huit ans que Victoire mène comme activité la vente des savons et divers produits à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Victoire vend du riz dans un marché du Bénin. Victoire exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Victoire sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupement MIDONOUGBO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MIDONOUGBO is a group of eleven persons whose members reside in the same district and belong to the same community. The group's representative, Victoire, whose hand is raised in the photo, is 50 years old and married to a man named Albert. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. The couple live together with the children and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Victoire left school at the elementary level. For eight years, she has had a business selling soaps and a variety of goods out of her home. Parallel to this business, she sells rice at a market in Benin. She operates her business with passion, and this enables her to support herself. She gets her supplies from a  market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Victoire is requesting, along with the other members of the group MIDONOUGBO, a second loan that will be used to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase various good and some soap to sell

loans.name: L'espoir 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Jonas est le coordinateur de son groupe L'Espoir 1, 2, 3 & 4. Il es un commercant. tous les membres de ce groupe vivent dans la région  DE BOR DE MER  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Jonas a dirigé son  commerce pendant 5 années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce Jonas  était un etudiant. Jonas voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit divers, . Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce de  produit divers. 

Des autres membres  militant  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Divers produit. Il dit que les  défis principal c est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Jonas is the coordinator of his group L’Espoir [“Hope”] 1, 2, 3 & 4. He is a vendor. All of the group members live in the Bord-de-Mer region, where electricity is scarce and water is very limited.

Jonas has been running his business for five years. Before launching his business, Jonas was a student. Jonas would like to use this loan to invest in miscellaneous items. He hopes that this loan will allow him to expand his business selling miscellaneous items.
Other members also need a loan for various uses, such as selling miscellaneous items. [Jonas] says that his goal is to become a major vendor.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items like shoes, clothes, cosmetics and other.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Darlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Darlyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

Darlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is 36 years old.  She is married and has six children.  She has run her own store for over five years and, before this, the only work she did was the household chores. She buys her products in a city once a week.

Mose has requested this loan from Yehu and she plans to use it to buy basic items like detergent, shampoo, flour and salt to increase her inventory.  She says that she needs to buy in large quantities so that she can obtain more income by fully supplying her store and attracting more customers.  This will allow her to provide her children with better living conditions and a more dignified life.

loans.use: to buy basic items like detergent, shampoo, flour and salt.

loans.name: Sounday Sèvèho

texts.fr: Sounday Sèvèho est âgé de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Sounday Sèvèho a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Sounday Sèvèho est marié à une marchande du nom de Mélanie. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, trois sont leurs propres enfants. Sounday Sèvèho vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Sounday Sèvèho mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la couture dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sounday Sèvèho vend des fagots de bois et divers articles ( riz et de l'huile végétale) à son domicile. Sounday Sèvèho s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sounday Sèvèho sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Soundahy Sèvèho is 37 years old and lives in Benin. He finished primary school. His wife, Mélanie, is a vendor. They have five children in their care, some of whom are in school. Three of the children’s are the couple’s own children. Soundahy Sèvèho lives together with his wife and children and, jointly with his wif,e provides for various family needs. In order to support his family, for about a dozen years Soundahy Sèvèho has been working as a tailor in his own shop. As a parallel business activity, he sells firewood and various items (such as rice and vegetable oil) out of his home. Soundahy Sèvèho stocks up in a town of Benin. With the goal of meeting demand and increasing his sales volume and his revenues, Soundahy Sèvèho is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the fourth time. This loan will allow him to expand his business and to earn a greater profit. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy some bags of rice and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 27 years old and married with six children who are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a loan of PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Thelma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Midonougbo 1 Group

texts.fr: MIDONOUGBO 1 est un groupement de vingt cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à une même collectivité. La représentante du groupe, Philomène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Armel. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Philomène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a trois ans environs que Philomène mène comme activité la vente d’ignames et des fruits dans un marché du Bénin. Philomène exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux besoins de sa famille. Philomène s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Philomène sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement MIDONOUGBO 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MIDONOUGBO 1 is a group of 25 persons whose members reside in the same district and belong to the same community. The group's representative, Philomène (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 28 years old and married to a man named Armel. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Philomène and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Philomène did not attend school. For about three years, she has been selling yams and fruit at a market in Benin. She operates this business with passion, and this enables her to help meet family needs. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Philomène is requesting, along with the other members of the group MIDONOUGBO 1, an initial loan that will be used to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase yams and fruit to sell

loans.name: Wadagbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WADAGBE 2 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des parentés résidant dans le même quartier La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Vihoutou Raymonde est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Vihoutou Raymonde est âgée de 56 ans et est mère de deux enfants dont aucun n’est scolarisé. Vihoutou Raymonde vit seule et assure seule ses divers besoins. Vihoutou Raymonde a peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a une vingtaine d’année environs que Vihoutou Raymonde mène comme activité la vente des ustensiles et des glacières par le système de distribution. Vihoutou Raymonde s’approvisionne au Ghana et au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Vihoutou Raymonde n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Vihoutou Raymonde et les autres membres du groupe WADAGBE 2 sollicitent ensemble un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The WADAGBE 2 group is made up of three people who are related and live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, Vihoutou Raymonde, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. This is the group's first request for support from ALIDé. They want to expand their businesses. Vihoutou Raymonde is 56 and has two children, neither of whom are in school. She lives independently and takes care of her needs on her own. She does not have much schooling. She has had her business for about twenty years now. She sells utensils and freezers through the distribution system. She gets her stock from Ghana and Togo. Demand is increasing, and she has limited means. She is not able to respond to her customers' demand. For this reason, and because all of the group members have limited resources, the WADAGBE 2 group is requesting their first loan together from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy utensils and freezers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and married to Lochodo. They are blessed with two children, aged 2 and 4 years old. John provides transport services with his motorbike, a business he ventured into two years ago.  He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

John wants to purchase a motorbike and has requested a second loan of KES 50,000. The profit he earns from his business will help him open a boutique business for his wife to manage. His dream is to see his business prosper, as well as to bring up a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 48 years old and married with 13 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Ma. Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Ma. Fe has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Ma. Fe aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for the embroidery business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Marilyn requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old.  She is married and has one child.  She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, soap and noodles.  She has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to stock and to sell.

In the future Lolita would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to stock and to sell.

loans.name: Manuchekhr

texts.ru: Манучехру 22 года. Он молодой, энергичный и приятный молодой человек. Манучехр с отличными оценками окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Среди однокурсников Манучехр имеет хороший статус и уважение. Он получает стипендию и очень любит читать зарубежную литературу. В свободное время он занимается спортом. Манучехр еще не женился и живет с родителями. Зарплата его родителей не хватает оплатить за учебу в университете и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 650 долларов США. Он является хорошим клиентом и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он надеется на вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем стать хорошим специалистом и таким образом осуществить его заветную мечту!
texts.en:
Manuchekhr is 22 years old. He is an energetic and pleasant young man. Manuchekhr graduated from high school with excellent grades and enrolled at the Tajik State University of Commerce. Among his classmates, Manuchekhr has a good status and respect. He received a scholarship and loves to read foreign literature. In his spare time, he likes to play sports. Manuchekhr is unmarried and lives with his parents. 

His parents' salary is not enough to cover his studies at the university and therefore he is requesting a loan of $650. He is a good customer and has a good credit history. He looks forward to your kindness. Let's help him become a good specialist, and thus to achieve his cherished dream!

loans.use: to pay for university studies

loans.name: Rita Elena

texts.es: Rita de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y a sus hijos, Actualmente vive en casa humilde pero propia. Es muy conocida por sus vecinos ya que se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer ejemplo y emprendedora que siempre su deseo ha sido brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos y que  el día de mañana ellos le agradezcan  todo lo que ella hace. Es honesta y trabajadora desde  hace un tiempo se ha dedicado a la agricultura de hortalizas y granos básicos siendo estos su principal fuente de ingresos diarios, todas las mañanas se levanta con alegría y entusiasmo para realizar con éxito su trabajo.  Rita desea seguir pagando un pequeño terreno que tiene donde ha sembrado su cosecha, además comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos, pero ya no tiene el capital necesario es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así poder seguir con la cosecha. Gracias a Dios posee de abundante clientela y es  así como ella podrá solventar la deuda antes del tiempo acordado.
texts.en:
Rita, 40, lives with her life partner and her children.  Currently she lives in a modest house of her own.  She's very well known among her neighbors because she has shown herself to be an example and an entrepreneur who always has wanted to give her children the best so they'll thank her in the future.

She's honest and hardworking.  For some time she has made a living growing vegetables and basic grains, her main source of daily income.  Every day she gets up happy and enthusiastic to be successful in her work.

Rita wants to continue paying for the small plot of land where she has planted her crop and to buy fertilizer.  She doesn't have the necessary capital, though, so she approached Integral to request a loan to be able to continue with her crop.

She's grateful to God that she has a lot of customers so she'll be able to pay her debt before the agreed-upon deadline.

loans.use: to continue paying for a plot of land and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like noodles and groceries to sell at her store.  She has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 53 years old.  She is married and has two children. 

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines.  Mary Ann has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She has been farming sugarcane for 15 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 24 times in the past in order to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a forty-four-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has four children. She has  been in the food vending business for fifteen years. She sells suman (a rice cake originating in the Philippines made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed in banana leaves),  biko (a Filipino sweet sticky traditional rice cake that is made of  glutinous rice or malagkit, coconut milk or gata) and puto (the Filipino term for “rice cake” which is cooked by steaming.). 

She has requested a loan of 11,000PHP to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, coconut milk and a new electric steamer. In the future, Avelina would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to elevate her status of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, sugar, coconut milk and a new electric steamer for her food business.

loans.name: Shirnennyambuu

texts.en:
Shirnennyambuu is 49 years old and lives with his three sons in outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He has supported his family by operating a TV repair business since 2000 and his elder son, who graduated from his university this spring, helps him to operate his business.  

It's really hard to live with four males in one house, so everybody in his family is a very hardworking guy. This fall the family plans to make a housing project. Thus, Shirnennyambuu is requesting this loan to purchase interior housing materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to make better living conditions for his family.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelina is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

Evelina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Evelina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Evelina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Evelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor es un hombre trabajador honesto y sincero que siempre se ha ganado la vida para darle lo mejor a su familia, viven en casa propia junto a su esposa, ella ayuda realizando oficios domésticos y dos nietos a quienes cuidan. Es muy responsable con sus labores diarias ya que siempre realiza lo mejor para sentirse satisfecho y agusto con lo que hace siempre buscando el bien para su familia. Desde muy joven ha sembrado maíz dos veces al año, con ello se ha ganado la vida siempre, a su vez posee un pequeño grupo de ganado (vacas) las que demandan su atención durante todo el día, ya que personalmente se encarga de su cuido, llevándolas a que pasten, las desparasita, vitamina, entre otras actividades, es dedicado siendo el hombre quien lleva el sustento diario a su hogar. Víctor desea seguir teniendo mas ganancias y que en su hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así poder terminar de pagar deuda del ganado, ya que las había adquirido por pagos y también comprar lo necesario para conservarlas sanas, espera y confía en Dios de que su ayuda será de gran utilidad y espera solventar la deuda antes del tiempo, ya que posee buenas referencias de pago.
texts.en:
Víctor is a hardworking, honest, and sincere man who always has earned a living to give his family the best.  He lives in his own house with his wife, who does the housework, and the two grandchildren they take care of.  He's very responsible with his daily work because he always does the best to feel satisfied and comfortable with what he does, always looking for the benefit for his family.

From a very young age he has grown corn twice a year, always making a living.  At the same time he has a small herd of cattle that demand his attention all day.  He personally cares for them, taking them to pasture, deworming them, giving them vitamins, and other things.  He's dedicated because he's the person who supports the household on a daily basis.

Víctor wants to continue earning more profit and to always have something to eat for his household.  This is why he went to Integral to request a loan.  This way he'll be able to finish paying back his debt on the cattle, because he had acquired them on installment.  He also wants to buy what he needs to keep the animals healthy.

He hopes and trusts in God that your help will be very useful.  He also hopes to pay back the debt early, because he has a good payment record.

loans.use: to finish paying for his cattle and to buy supplies to keep them healthy

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gloria is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gloria has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Gloria has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is 42 years old and lives in Kaspi district with her family. She has a husband, three daughters (13, 17 and 19 years old) and parents-in-law. Her parents-in-law are pensioners. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 3 milk cows whose milk is used in dairy products. Iamze sells the dairy near the district she lives called Gori. In addition, she has 15 sheep and a horse. Iamze takes good care of her livestock and works hard to improve the living conditions for her family.

Iamze has requested a loan to purchase an additional horse. Her husband will take wood from the forest with the horse and sell the wood in their village and nearby villages. It will increase their income. The increased profit will be reinvested in the family agricultural business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and take the wood from the forest

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 39-year-old married man and a father to one son. He lives in Jabalia refugee camp where there are few chances of jobs.

Raed wants to start his new project as a taxi driver and he wants to have his own taxi to meet the increasing demand of customer requests. Raed has some money but not enough to purchase the taxi, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase the taxi. Taking this loan will allow Raed to own the taxi and take internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Raed is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 46 years old and married with one kid.

Minerva is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Minerva has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha, 35, lives with her family. She has a food stall where she sells various foods. She has had the business for two years and is very well known in the town because her dishes are so delicious. She has gotten many regular customers, who prefer her because everything is made with high-quality ingredients at affordable prices and with unparalleled customer service.

Mwanasha is an active woman who is very devoted to her work. She likes to fight for what she wants. Every day she hopes for a more prosperous future, so she makes the maximum effort. She doesn't plan to give up until she is successful.

Demand has gone up in the past weeks and she wants to take advantage of that to make a new investment. That's why she's requesting a loan from Yehu to buy rice, wheat flour, meat, beans, vegetables, etc.

She assumes responsibility for paying off the debt and, at the same time, is confident that she'll be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, meat, beans, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 50 years old and a widow with four children. Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29500 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store.

Elsie has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from a junk shop, motorcycle transport, and raising pigs.

Elsie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 60 years old and has ten children. Lucita is widowed and two of her children are in school.

Lucita is in the agricultural business and farms vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 19000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

Lucita has been farming vegetables for 20 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.ru: Шарифчону 20 лет. Он очень умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Шарифчон является студентом 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса по специальности финансового менеджмента. Он учится отлично и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. Родители занимаются купле продажей мужской одежды, но их доход не позволяет им оплатить за учебу сына. Шарифчон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sharifjon is 20 years old. He is a very clever and hardworking young man. Sharifjon is a second year student at Tajik State University of Politics and Business majoring in financial management. He studies well and is actively involved in all activities of the university. 

His parents are involved in the purchase and sale of men's clothing, but their income does not allow them to pay for their son's schooling. Sharifjon is requesting a loan to pay for his university studies. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Zikiryo

texts.ru: Зикирё житель Пянджского района. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. Зикирё вместе с женой занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи и сеет хлопок. Этим видом деятельности Зикирё занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Zikiryo is a resident of Pyandj region. He is 35 years old and married. Together with his wife, Zikiryo engages in farming crops. He grows vegetables and cotton. Zikiryo has been involved in these types of activities for five years. He is taking a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.ru:
Геннадий живет и работает в Мелитополе. Он зарабатывает на жизнь тем, что торгует мужской одеждой на выездных рынках города Мелитополя. 
Геннадию необходима дополнительная сумма в 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить оборотные средства и закупить сезонный товар под реализацию. Геннадий планирует закупить рубашки, свитера и т.д. для того, чтобы увеличить свой товарооборот и продолжать дальше наращивать ассортимент.
texts.en:
Gennadyi lives and works in Melitopol. He earns his living by selling menswear in the visiting markets of Melitopol. 
 
Gennadyi needs an additional amount of 4,000 hryvnia to replenish his working capital and to buy seasonal goods on consignment. Gennadyi plans to buy shirts, sweaters, and the like, in order to increase his turnover and continue to further increase his range.

loans.use: to buy shirts and sweaters to increase his turnover

loans.name: Alowanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOWANOU est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies exercant les mêmes activités et s’approvisionnant au même endroit. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Sègbégnon Christophe est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sègbégnon Christophe est âgé de 48 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Sourou. Le couple a huit enfants dont certains scolarisés. Sègbégnon Christophe Philippe n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sègbégnon Christophe vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Sègbégnon Christophe assure ensemble avec sa femme, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Sègbégnon Christophe exerce le métier de forgeron à son domicile. Sègbégnon Christophe exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans. Sègbégnon Christophe s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sègbégnon Christophe sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOWANOU, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Alowanou group is made up of three friends who run similar businesses and buy their stock from the same place.  The representative of the group, Sègbégnon Christophe is the one pictured in the photo with his hand raised.  Sègbégnon Christophe is 48 years old and is married to a hair stylist named Sourou.  The couple has eight children, some of whom are in school.  Sègbégnon Christophe never attended school himself. Sègbégnon Christophe lives together with his wife and children.  Both he and his wife work to assure the needs of their household.

In order to provide for his various expenses, Sègbégnon Christophe practices blacksmithing out of his home. He has been practicing this craft for twenty years.  He buys his stock in his locale, as well as a city in Benin.

In the hopes of better satisfying his clientele, as well as improving his turnover and profits, Sègbégnon Christophe is asking for a fourth loan by way of ALIDé along with the other members of the Alowanou group.  This loan will be used to grow their inventories and to boost their clientele.  The previously issued loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase iron.

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: Leonel es un hombre muy emprendedor, su mayor deseo ha sido brindarle un buen presente y futuro a su esposa, quien lo ha acompañado siempre que lo ha necesitado. Es responsable, amigable, siempre con el deseo de que en su mesa nunca falte el pan de cada día. Leonel  trabaja vendiendo y elaborando papas, plátanos y yuca tostada en un lugar cerca de su vivienda, pero aparte de esa gran labor se dedica a la agricultura de maíz siendo esta una se sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Necesita comprar insumos agrícolas pero por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para invertir en esto es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y poder así comprar los suficientes insumos como: fertilizantes, pesticidas u otros para así tener una cosecha sana y abundante. Espera contar con la ayuda solicitada y así también solventarla antes del tiempo acordado.
texts.en:
Leonel is a very enterprising man.  His greatest desire has been to give a good present and future to his wife, who has been with him whenever he has needed her to be.  He's responsible and friendly, and always wants there to be food for his table.

Leonel works selling and making potatoes, bananas, and roasted yucca in a place near his house.  In addition to this big job he makes a living growing corn, one of his main sources of income.

He needs to buy agricultural inputs but at the moment doesn't have sufficient capital to invest in them.  This is why he approached Integral for a loan to buy adequate supplies, such as fertilizer, pesticide, and other things, to have a healthy and abundant crop.

He hopes to get the requested help and also to be able to repay it before the deadline.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 53 years old and married with four children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, laundry soap and other groceries.

Amelita has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, laundry soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than ten years now. She also runs a sari-sari or convenience store selling various goods and commodities to people in the commodity.

Marina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice and additional items to sell such as noodles, rice, soda and others.

In the future, Marina hopes to expand her ventures to augment her income and experience the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice and additional items to sell such as noodles, rice, soda and others

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия живет в городе Хуст, Западная Украина. Она – замужем, у нее двое детей. Дочка скоро окончит школу, поэтому Наталия надеется подкопить достаточную сумму, чтобы помочь дочери получить высшее образование в университете. 
Наталии понадобилась сумма в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести морозильную камеру, чтобы делать полноценные заготовки на зиму. Кредит поможет Наталии улучшить ее материальное положение, так как за счет этой суммы она сможет заготовить некоторые продукты, закупив их по сходной цене, а также сможет хранить в этой камере мясо, которое передают ей родители из села.
texts.en:
Nataliya lives in the town of Khoost, Western Ukraine. She is married and has two children. Her daughter will soon graduate from school, therefore Nataliya hopes to store up enough money to help her daughter to study at the university.  

Nataliya needed the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to buy a freezer in order to make the full preparation for winter. The loan will help Nataliya to improve her financial situation, since by that amount, she will be able to procure some of the products, by purchasing them at a reasonable price, and she will also be able to store meat in the freezer that her parents give her from the village.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Jesuskpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUSKPEGO est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies vivant dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, Médjikouè Geneviève, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 30 ans. Médjikouè Geneviève est mariée à un certain Lahissi et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste à la charge du couple. Le couple vit ensemble avec leur enfant et assure ensemble les différentes charges. Médjikouè Geneviève n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Médjikouè Geneviève vend des condiments et des poissons à son domicile. Il y a environs quinze ans que Médjikouè Geneviève exerce cette activité. Médjikouè Geneviève s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Médjikouè Geneviève ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Médjikouè Geneviève sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUSKPEGO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesuskpego Group is made up of three friends who live in the same area.  The representative of the group, Médjikouè Geneviève is 30 years old. She is pictured in the photo with her hand raised.  She is married to a man named Lahissi and has four children, all of whom are attending school and are dependents.  The couple lives together with their children and together provide for the needs of the household.

Médjikouè Geneviève has never attended school.  She sells spices and fish out of her home.  She has been doing this for about fifteen years.  Médjikouè Geneviève stocks up in regions of Benin.

With a view to boosting the level of her business, Médjikouè Geneviève hopes to grow her inventory; this will allow her to better respond to the demands of her clientele.  To this end, Médjikouè Geneviève is asking for a fourth loan by way of ALIDé along with the other members of the Jesuskpego Group.  The previously issued loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase spices.

loans.name: Resse

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Resse works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Resse is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more eggs and dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Resse has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Myra works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Myra is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell for her buy and sell frozen foods business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 57 years old and married.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her variety store.

Lorna has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lorna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita is 43 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Enelita requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Enelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Borrower Mrs. Altantuya is a 39-year-old married entrepreneur. She lives with her spouse and 5-year-old daughter, who attends kindergarten in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia.
